title: Purchasing Agent/Production Scheduler
description:
**About Lubrizol**  

The Lubrizol Corporation, a Berkshire Hathaway company, is a specialty chemical company whose science delivers sustainable solutions to advance mobility, improve wellbeing and enhance modern life. Founded in 1928, Lubrizol owns and operates more than 100 manufacturing facilities, sales, and technical offices around the world and has about 8,000 employees. For more information, visit www.Lubrizol.com.
We value diversity in professional backgrounds and life experiences. By enabling a consistent, unbiased, and transparent recruitment process, Lubrizol seeks to create a positive experience for candidates so we can get to know them at their best. We recognize unique work and life situations and offer flexibility, ensuring our employees feel engaged and fulfilled in every aspect of life.
**Education – Experience Requirements**  


Five years of experience in manufacturing and/or production planning. Must be proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel. Previous experience with SAP is helpful. A bachelor’s degree in science or business is also helpful for this position.  


**Background**  


The Purchasing Agent / Production Scheduler reports to the Plant Manager. This position works closely with the Warehouse, Production, Customer Service, and Supply Chain functions to ensure that adequate product inventories are maintained through proper production planning and disciplined manufacturing schedules.  


Because of the size of the Clifton plant, the Purchasing Agent / Production Scheduler must fulfill several roles. Specific job functions of the Purchasing Agent / Production Scheduler are described as follows:  


**Specific Job Functions**  


**A:** **Inventory Control**  


* Determines products that need to be manufactured and establishes a production schedule based on customer demand, safety stock levels, and capacity constraints.
  


* Coordinates with Customer Service and Supply Chain functions concerning the availability of made-to-order products and other products that are below safety stock levels. Notifies Customer Service immediately if due date cannot be met so that the customer can be contacted.
  


* Assists to establish safety stock levels for all Clifton manufactured packaged products based on historical usage, sales forecasts, and current customer demand requirements.
  


* Closely monitors slow moving and non-working (NWSM) inventories by reworking and blending as production schedule permits.
  


* Coordinates with Warehouse Manager to ensure that finished product stock is maintained at an adequate level and that storage space issues are addressed.
  


B: **Raw Material Procurement**  


* Purchases all raw materials that are required to support the production schedule.
  


* Confirms pricing of raw materials through interaction with suppliers and Corporate Purchasing.
  


* Investigates into alternate suppliers for raw materials based on changes in the marketplace in respect to pricing and availability.
  


* Investigates into sources of alternate versions of raw materials in attempt to improve productivity and safety. Examples are the purchase of fatty acids in bulk versus solid flaked form, and the procurement of granular materials versus powder form which reduces dust exposure to employees during handling.
  


* Establishes specific shipping requirements with suppliers regarding tank truck equipment, labeling, pallets, type and size of containers, and delivery times.
  


* Represents the Clifton plant with quality and service issues involving raw materials and suppliers.
  


* Maintains service / quality records for all raw material suppliers.
  


* Assures that applicable suppliers meet RSPO requirements.
  


C: **Production Planning Scheduling**  


* Establishes production schedule based on inventory levels, historical usage, sales forecasts, and customer requirements. This includes all types of packaging types (pails, drums, totes, and tank trucks).
  


* Ensures that raw materials are on hand and/or planned to support the production schedule.
  


* Coordinates with Plant Manager on production schedule, bulk raw material deliveries, and packaging requirements.
  


* Coordinates with Warehouse Manager on the receipt of packaged raw materials.
  


* Monitors production execution versus schedule and coordinates with Plant Manager on production priorities, schedule conflicts, rejected / non-conforming batches, and schedule revisions.
  


D: **Computer Entry**  


* Enters raw material purchase orders into the SAP S4 computer system.
  


* Creates bulk and packaged process orders in SAP for individual batches.
  


* Generates batch sheets to support the production schedule.
  


* Reconciles completed batch sheets and enters raw material consumptions, final product yields, processing times, and container usage into SAP.
  


* Reviews batch data in SAP for individual products to reflect current bill of materials, raw material sequencing, yield, and processing time conditions. This effort is coordinated with the Plant Manager and Plant Controller by analyzing variances monthly.
  


E. **Other Responsibilities**  


* Performs back-up role to the Warehouse Manager for all Transportation



Management related functions within S4.  


* Helps support the Production Department during the absence of the Plant Manager.
  


* Maintains inventory levels of totes, filter pads, and other operating supplies that are critical for the plant.
  


* Contacts raw material suppliers regarding technical requests.
  


* Coordinates the recycling of empty raw material containers.
  


* Fills critical role in the annual site physical inventory process.
  


* Generates blanket purchase orders with vendors who perform routine services for the plant and laboratory. Included are plant utilities (natural gas and electricity).
  


* Purchases many miscellaneous items such as office supplies, plant equipment, and maintenance items.
  


* Provides pricing trend information on raw materials to Corporate Purchasing. Also, provides feedback to Corporate Purchasing on supplier performance which is used for the development of contracts.
  


* Obtains raw material samples for new products, formulation changes, and supports other sites such as Bowling Green as needed.
  


 11) Supports the Plant Manager on special projects as required. An example is the
implementation of ISO9001.  


12) Supports the Plant Manager on HSE&S related responsibilities that include
 inspections, training, reporting, and permit issuance.  

13) Follows all plant safety and ethics rules and procedures. A “team player” attitude
 is a must for this position.  


F**.** **Financial Responsibilities**  


 * Responsible for the typical annual purchase of approximately $5,000,000 in raw materials.
  


* Responsible for the typical annual purchase of approximately $ 225,000 in containers (drums, totes, pails, pallets, etc.).

  


* Responsible for the typical annual purchase of approximately $100,000 in hard goods and service-related purchase orders.
  


* Responsible for the typical annual purchase of approximately $200,000 in plant utilities (natural gas and electricity).
  


* Maintains Corporate purchasing card with an annual limit of $240,000.



**Ready for your next career step? Apply today and let's shape the future together!**
It’s an exciting time to be part of Lubrizol. Lubrizol is not staying put. We are continually learning and evolving. Our passion delivers our success — not only for Lubrizol but for those who count on us every day: our employees, customers and communities.
We work with a relentless commitment to operate safely and responsibly, keeping safety, sustainability, ethics, and compliance at the forefront of everything we do. The well-being of our employees, customers and communities is paramount to our culture and in the way we approach our work.
As a diverse, global team, we work together to solve some of the world’s most pressing challenges. We impact everyday lives through science only Lubrizol can deliver, and we never stop pushing to do it better.
One of the founding principles of The Lubrizol Corporation more than 90 years ago was treating every employee with dignity and respect. That same commitment is only stronger today.
More than that, we are committed to providing an environment where every employee can be the best they can be, no matter their race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic.  

  

**Job Segment:** Plant, Plant Manager, Industrial, Chemical Research, Warehouse, Manufacturing, Engineering

title: Merchandising Specialist, VIE
description:
**Position Overview**

Tiffany & Co. is seeking a dynamic and experienced VIE Merchandising Specialist with a retail-first and client-centric mindset to join the North America Merchandising team. In 360-partnership with zone cross-functional teams you will develop and execute market-specific merchandising strategy for Tiffany & Company, Americas. Primary functions include: support the larger Americas Merchandising team with meaningful and insightful reporting and analytics to drive increased productivity and growth, streamline and communicate corporate strategies and product information to the greater retail network, gather and synthesize consumer as well as market insights and partner closely with New York head-office product teams as an advocate for larger zone needs.  



**Key Accountabilities:**

**Business Responsibilities:**

* Develop and negotiate category both assortments and forecasts with New York head-office product team
* Create, review, and evolve assortment plans by store based on local market needs
* Create comprehensive 360 action plans to drive new launches as well as larger category ambitions
* Capitalize on growth trends and develop strategies to address underperforming collections and/or stores
* In partnership with Supply Chain, maximize sell thru via regular business analysis
* Provide quantitative reports and quantitative retail feedback to zone leadership and New York head-office product team
* Assortment flex, rebalance and reorder
* Identify new business opportunities through sales analysis, retail feedback and competitive research.

**Retail Support:**

* Establish credibility and build strong relationships with retail leaders and client advisors
* Develop and deploy both tactical category training as well as strategic messaging to ensure retail support in larger zone initiatives
* Frequent store visits to gather feedback, support client events and constantly assess merchandising decisions as realized in retail environments

**Analysis**

* Creation and maintenance of daily/weekly/monthly retail sales reports
* Review assortments and recommend updates to improve store productivity and maximize growth
* Monitor trends, partner with Supply Chain to improve forecast accuracy and identify risks/opportunities
* Lead performance deep dives to guide the Merchandising team in developing store/collection/category strategies
* Create presentations to clearly communicate analytic findings
Provide ad hoc analytical support and perform special projects as needed  
* 

**Required Qualifications:**

* 3+ years business experience based on level
* Strong analytical skills
* Excellent written/verbal communication and diplomacy skills
* Process-oriented with sound decision-making skills
* Possess overall luxury aesthetic sensibility
* Self-motivated with a strong drive for achievement
* Proven ability to function effectively in a highly dynamic team environment (ability to multi-task is essential)
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Windows environment with adaptability to new software  
* 

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Master's Degree in continuing education, preferably in MBA/Marketing/Management
* Working Knowledge of Tiffany & Co. merchandising information systems
* Working Knowledge of Tiffany & Co. operations
* Prior Merchandising or Retail experience preferably in a luxury brand
* Proficient Knowledge of basic retail concepts and calculations preferred

The hiring range for this position is $5,556.35 (€ 5072.76) per month

title: Construction Cost Accountant
description:
**Junior Construction Cost Accountant**  
**Velez Organization**

At Velez Organization, a leading Minority and Woman-Owned construction management firm, we are dedicated to maintaining the highest standards of safety, quality, and excellence on every project. We are seeking a motivated Junior Construction Cost Accountant to join our dynamic team and support the financial success of our construction projects.

**Position Overview:**  
As a Junior Construction Cost Accountant, you will assist in managing project finances, ensuring accurate tracking of costs and financial reporting. You will collaborate closely with the Construction Manager, project teams, subcontractors, and vendors to contribute to the successful completion of our projects.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Cost Tracking: Assist in monitoring and analyzing project costs, preparing budgets and forecasts to maintain financial accountability.
* Financial Reporting: Support the preparation of financial reports, including profit and loss statements, for project managers and stakeholders.
* Billing and Invoicing: Help process payment requests and ensure timely invoicing to clients and subcontractors.
* Subcontractor and Vendor Review: Review and verify invoices from subcontractors and vendors for accuracy and compliance with contractual terms.
* Change Order Support: Assist in the development and coordination of change orders, tracking cost impacts effectively.
* Documentation Maintenance: Help maintain accurate financial records and documentation, including contracts, invoices, and receipts.
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with the Construction Manager and project teams to provide financial insights and support throughout the project lifecycle.
* Compliance Assurance: Ensure compliance with relevant financial regulations and standards.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Construction Management, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* 1 to 3 years of experience in construction accounting or a related field.
* Proficiency in accounting software, such as QuickBooks or similar systems.
* Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective collaboration with project teams and stakeholders.
* Ability to work independently while managing multiple tasks effectively.
* A passion for construction and a desire to contribute to a growing and impactful company.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
* Opportunity to work on challenging and rewarding projects.
* Collaborative and dynamic work environment.
* The chance to make a meaningful impact in the community with a company committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

**How to Apply:**  
We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you’re a talented and motivated individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply!

**Equal Opportunity Statement:**  
Velez Organization is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

**Legal Disclaimer:**  
This job description provides a general overview of the responsibilities and qualifications required for the position. Other duties may be assigned to meet business needs. Employment is at-will unless otherwise stated, and nothing in this posting should be construed as an employment contract.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

title: Insurance Verification Specialist
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Insurance Verification Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for verifying patient insurance information, ensuring accuracy in medical records, and facilitating communication between patients, healthcare providers, and insurance companies. The ideal candidate will possess strong knowledge of medical coding and insurance processes, including familiarity with ICD-10 and ICD-9 coding systems.

**Duties**  
- Verify patient insurance eligibility and benefits prior to services rendered.  
- Communicate effectively with patients regarding their insurance coverage and any necessary documentation.  
- Collaborate with medical office staff to resolve any discrepancies in patient information.  
- Maintain accurate records of all verification activities and updates in the system.  
- Stay updated on managed care policies and changes in insurance regulations.

**Requirements**  
- Proven experience in a medical office or dental office setting preferred.  
- Strong understanding of medical coding principles, including ICD-10 and ICD-9.  
- Familiarity with managed care processes and insurance verification procedures.  
- Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.  
- Ability to handle sensitive information while adhering to HIPAA guidelines.  
- Proficient in using office software and electronic medical record (EMR) systems.  
- Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.

Join our dedicated team as an Insurance Verification Specialist where your expertise will contribute to providing exceptional service to our patients while ensuring compliance with industry standards.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

Experience:

* ICD-10: 1 year (Preferred)
* Medical coding: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Purchase, NY 10577 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Purchase, NY 10577: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: One to One Support
description:
**Rebecca School** is a developmental program that utilizes the **DIRFloortime method** developed by Dr. Stanley Greenspan. Rebecca School is opening a new location in **Mount Vernon, NY** for the 2024 school year and is **seeking qualified 1:1 Paraprofessionals** to work with students age 3 to 21 with neurodevelopmental delays in relating, communicating and thinking. As a One to One Support, you will join our classroom team and work in collaboration with Special Education teachers and other professionals to fulfill the individual curriculum and self-care needs of the students. Rebecca School North is an expansion of the Rebecca School in NYC after 18 successful years of serving students with neurodevelopment delays in relating and communicating.



Have a great work/life balance while helping others. Hours of employment: 8:00 am-3:30 pm (M, TH, F) 8:00am-4:30pm (T, W)



Salary Range: 34,000-40,000 based on 12 months and degree.


**RESPONSIBILITIES | WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING**


* Support assigned student with all facets of the school day and participation in classroom activities to the best of the student's abilities
* Work closely with head teacher and teaching assistants to ensure implementation of assigned student's Individualized Treatment Plan
* Assist student in the classroom and collaborate with team members and related service providers to support goal achievement
* Implement DIRFloortime strategies and techniques during instruction and interactions
* Assist students during participation in specials such as physical education, art, music, and community outings
* Participate in weekly team, department and process group meetings


**QUALIFICATIONS | WHAT YOU BRING**


* Strong interpersonal skills to establish and maintain effective working relationships with child, parent/guardian, interdisciplinary team members, and other personnel involved in child’s educational program
* Knowledge of neurodevelopmental delays exhibited by children and adolescents
* Strong communication skills
* Professional appearance and demeanor
* Experience with DIRFloortime (or open to learning about it)


**BENEFITS | WHAT WE OFFER**



Eligible Rebecca School Employees will receive competitive pay and benefits including:


* Medical, Dental, Vision, and Health Savings Account (HSA)
* Company-paid Short-Term Disability and Life Insurance
* Voluntary Life Insurance, Long-Term Disability, Hospital, and Accident Coverage
* Generous paid time off and paid holidays
* Tuition reimbursement
* 401K with 100% vested company contribution
* Healthcare, dependent care, and commuter Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Wellness Incentive Program
* Employee Discount Program
* Rewards program which allows you to earn points to purchase items


**Rebecca School** is part of the New Story network of schools, clinics and services. New Story (the parent company) is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and embraces diversity in the workplace. We are also committed to providing a drug-free, safe workplace for our employees and the students we serve. For more information about New Story Schools careers and benefits, please visit our website https://newstoryjobs.com/
company_description: Rebecca School is a therapeutic day school for children ages 4 to 21, promoting the education and development of children with neurodevelopmental disorders of relating and communicating.

title: Practice Manager
description:
Orlin & Cohen Orthopedic Group is the premier and fastest-growing orthopedic practice on Long Island, providing comprehensive care that helps thousands of our neighbors live more active lives, free from pain. Orlin & Cohen is one of the largest orthopedics practices in the region, with over 20 offices in Nassau and Suffolk Counties, Queens, and Staten Island, we have been in business for 29 years and have over 1200 dedicated healthcare employees in our care. Team members enjoy competitive salaries, exceptional medical benefits, and generous PTO.

Orlin & Cohen Orthopedic Group is seeking additional high-caliber office managers to join our team. Our busy, fully-staffed office requires experienced professionals with strong management, leadership, and communication skills. The ideal candidate will demonstrate a positive and supportive demeanor, along with a strong customer-service orientation. Relevant, proven experience is essential. The ability to function independently as well as collaboratively with other members of the management team is critical. We offer generous compensation and benefits for the right talent!

**Full-Time Opportunity! Monday - Friday (9am-5pm)**

* Occasional travel required between our Orlin & Cohen locations.

\\*Minimum 2 years management experience REQUIRED

\\*Neuro experience PREFERRED

**Essential Job Responsibilities:**

* Oversees daily office operations and delegates authority to assigned supervisors.
* Assists supervisors in developing and implementing short- and long-term work plans and objectives for clerical functions.
* Assists supervisors in understanding/implementing clinic policies and procedures.
* Develops guidelines for prioritizing work activities, evaluating effectiveness, and modifying activities as necessary. Ensures that office is staffed appropriately.
* Assists in the recruiting, hiring, orientation, development, and evaluation of clerical staff.
* Establishes and maintains an efficient and responsive patient flow system.
* Oversees and approves office supply inventory, ensures that mail is opened and processed, and offices are opened and closed according to procedures.
* Supports and upholds established policies, procedures, objectives, quality improvement, safety, environmental and infection control, and codes and requirements of accreditation and regulatory agencies.

**Education and Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree preferred.
* Minimum five years of healthcare administrative experience, including two years of management experience in health care.

***Thank you for your interest in working with Orlin & Cohen!***

**\\*We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.**

**\\*\\*The salary range and/or hourly rate listed is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job advertisement and may be modified in the future. When determining a team member's base salary and/or rate, several factors may be considered as applicable (e.g., location, specialty, service line, years of relevant experience, education, credentials, budget and internal equity).\\*\\***

**#AJ1**

title: Account Representative - State Farm Agent Team Member
description:
Position Overview  

  

Are you outgoing and customer-focused? Do you enjoy working with the public? If you answered yes to these questions, working for a State Farm independent contractor agent may be the career for you! State Farm agents market only State Farm insurance and financial service products.  

  

Responsibilities  

  

* Establish customer relationships and follow up with customers, as needed.
* Use a customer-focused, needs-based review process to educate customers about insurance options.
* Develop leads, schedule appointments, identify customer needs, and market appropriate products and services.

As an Agent Team Member, you will receive...  

  

* Salary plus commission/bonus
* Paid time off (vacation and personal/sick days)
* Flexible hours
* Growth potential/Opportunity for advancement within my agency
* Hiring Bonus up to $

Requirements  

  

* Interest in marketing products and services based on customer needs
* Excellent communication skills - written, verbal and listening
* People-oriented
* Detail oriented
* Proactive in problem solving
* Able to learn computer functions
* Ability to work in a team environment

If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process.  

  

This position is with a State Farm independent contractor agent, not with State Farm Insurance Companies. Employees of State Farm agents must be able to successfully complete any applicable licensing requirements and training programs. State Farm agents are independent contractors who hire their own employees. State Farm agents’ employees are not employees of State Farm.

title: Teaching Assistant
description:
**Rebecca School** is a developmental program that utilizes the DIRFloortime method developed by Dr. Stanley Greenspan. Rebecca School is opening a new location in **Mount Vernon, NY** for the 2024 school year and is seeking bachelors level **Teaching Assistants** to work with students age 3 to 21 with neuro-developmental delays in relating, communicating and thinking. As a Teaching Assistant, you will support students within the school as well as out in the community. A successful Teaching Assistant at Rebecca School should exhibit safety awareness, display the ability to challenge students to relate, communicate and think in all aspects of their development, and be a big picture thinker. Teaching Assistants support each student's individualized developmental program through collaboration with the interdisciplinary team.



Salary: $40,000 - $50,000 per year, depending on education and experience (based on a 12-month position)


**RESPONSIBILITIES | WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING**


* Assist in taking care of the special needs of the students
* Assist with individualized instruction and work with small groups of students
* Complete clerical duties as assigned by the teacher
* Assist students with various projects and curriculum tasks
* Help with the supervision of students on field trips planned by the teacher
* Assist the teacher in devising special strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on a sympathetic understanding of individual students, their needs, interests and abilities
* Operate and care for equipment used in the classroom for instructional purposes
* Help students master equipment or instructional materials assigned by the teacher
* Distribute and collect workbooks, papers and other materials for instruction


**QUALIFICATIONS | WHAT YOU BRING**


* Bachelor's Degree or higher
* Effective verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to establish and maintain working relationships with students, staff and parents


**BENEFITS | WHAT WE OFFER**

  


Eligible Rebecca School Employees will receive competitive pay and benefits including:


* Medical, Dental, Vision, and Health Savings Account (HSA)
* Company-paid Short-Term Disability and Life Insurance
* Voluntary Life Insurance, Long-Term Disability, Hospital, and Accident Coverage
* Generous paid time off and paid holidays
* Tuition reimbursement
* 401K with 100% vested company contribution
* Healthcare, dependent care, and commuter Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Wellness Incentive Program
* Employee Discount Program
* Rewards program which allows you to earn points to purchase items


**Rebecca School** is part of the New Story network of schools, clinics and services. New Story (the parent company) is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and embraces diversity in the workplace. We are also committed to providing a drug-free, safe workplace for our employees and the students we serve. For more information about New Story Schools careers and benefits, please visit our website https://newstoryjobs.com/

#### **Experience**


Preferred* Successful experience working with children in a special education setting (preferred)

#### **Education**


Required* Bachelors or better
company_description: Rebecca School is a therapeutic day school for children ages 4 to 21, promoting the education and development of children with neurodevelopmental disorders of relating and communicating.

title: Operations Project Manager
description:
**About:** 

Collins Building Services (CBS) is proud to be a leading firm in facility management throughout the New York Tri-State area for over 30 years. Clients choose us for our commitments of superior quality service, transparency, and innovation, tailored to their individual needs. With over 3,200 employees, Collins Building Services’ operations team is responsible in advocating for the customer’s voice, ensuring the best personalized service to all clients.

This is a unique opportunity to join an established company that is investing in constant innovation, turning customer feedback into actionable insights for business success and expansion. If you want to work for a company that’s focused on providing you the best experience with a continued focus on your personal growth and development – join the CBS Operations Team!

**Job Overview:** 

The Project Manager will be responsible for directing and overseeing the activities of all CBS facilities team members in a retail facilities environment. The primary responsibility is to ensure that all daily and periodic requirements are completed to the highest standards and according to schedule. Additionally, the manager will maintain client relations and ensure that client requests are promptly addressed.

**Responsibilities:**

**Client Relations and Team Management**

* Motivates, directs, trains and coaches all employees to meet facilities requirements.
* Conducts quality control checks.
* Implements technical training as needed to improve the team’s skill set.
* Adheres to specifications as set forth by contractual agreements and company standards.
* Promptly manages client request and responds to client complaints.
* Recommends services and maintenance care to clients.
* Maintains constant communication with Clients and Property Management to ensure quality service.

**Inventory and Supply Management**

* Manages and distribute equipment, supplies, and other materials in a cost effective and efficient manner.
* Maintains an organized inventory and is accountable for all equipment, supplies and materials.
* Arranges for equipment maintenance and repairs.
* Audits team usage for accuracy and quality checks.

**Administration, Safety, Training, and other Responsibilities**

* Maintains accurate timekeeping records daily and submits weekly payrolls.
* Maintains personnel calendars and documents sick, personal, holiday and other applicable records.
* Accurately and promptly generates work orders.
* Maintains safety records, investigates work related and liability incidents, reports incidents according to safety and OSHA regulations, and coordinates and conducts required safety trainings.
* Submits change of space forms, section lists and other pertinent location reports.
* Adheres to client specific administrative reports, documentation, and other requests.

**Qualifications and Competencies:** 

* High School Degree required; College degree desired or equivalent work experience.
* Must have 5-7 years of prior supervisory experience in a retail facilities maintenance position or similar industry.
* Successful experience with managing, motivating, training and coaching teams.
* Knowledge of and ability to train on compliance for OSHA, and DOH and other regulatory agencies.
* Strong relationship building skills, specifically able to build effective relationships with building management, other facility teams, client representatives, CBS staff and management.
* Experience with managing in a union environment and labor relations highly desired.
* Strong computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft Suite.
* Excellent timekeeping, personnel record management and payroll skills.
* Proactively raises opportunities to clients and seeks additional business whenever possible.
* Must have attention to detail and a high standard for accuracy.
* Self-starter able to work with a high degree of urgency and under pressure to meet deadlines.
* Able to work in a fast-paced environment prioritizing multiple projects.
* Strong English communication skills both written and verbal.
* Desire to be successful and solution driven.
* Professionalism and actively contributes to a positive work environment.
* Ability to work successfully in a team environment and drive team productivity.
* Ability to coach and elevate any obstacles or concerns appropriately.
* Ability to travel to various job locations.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* Are you open and available to work weekends and holidays?
* Are you able to reliably commute to the Long Island region?
* Do you have experience with work-order and/or inspection systems?
* Do you have experience managing a retail facility?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* Facilities Management: 5 years (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

Work Location: Multiple locations

title: Legal & Business Affairs
description:
**About the NBCA:** 

The National Basketball Coaches Association (NBCA) is the labor association that represents Head and Assistant basketball Coaches in the National Basketball Association (NBA). Founded in 1976 by legendary Boston Celtics Player and Coach, Tommy Heinsohn, our organization consists of all NBA Head Coaches, Assistant Coaches and alumni, and works closely with the NBA on all legal and business matters that pertain to the coaching profession. We offer each NBA Coach (Head & Assistant) the opportunity to get involved in our Association that was built for, continues to exist for, and is run by our great NBA Coaches.

**Location & Office Policy/Requirement:**

The NBCA office is located in New York, NY. The NBCA work and office requirement for this role is hybrid, with expectations to work in the office two days per week, as directed by the NBCA Executive Director & General Counsel. There is minimal travel required for this role during one to two major NBCA tentpole events throughout the year.

**Position Summary:**

Ever wonder how NBA Coaches collaborate off the court? This is your chance to be the bridge between Coaches and a host of other partners, including the NBA, the NBPA, and 30 NBA Teams. As a key member of the Legal & Business Affairs, you will work on challenging and high-profile matters with executives who are recognized as leaders in their fields. In addition, you will gain first-hand experience in a dynamic and intellectually stimulating in-house labor association environment. Our collaborative philosophy fosters an open-door and forward-thinking environment, and you will be a part of the social fabric of the Association. You will support and collaborate closely with our Executive Director & General Counsel to achieve our stated goals:

* To promote the profession of NBA Basketball Coach.
* To secure maximum salary opportunities, disability and retirement benefits and individual and group marketing opportunities for its members.
* To act as a liaison between the NBA and its body of Coaches.
* To coordinate regular meetings for its members where information and ideas concerning the sport of basketball and coaching may be exchanged.
* To create opportunities for Coaches in radio, television, the internet, publishing and other related activities, and for opportunities in international coaching clinics and international basketball.
* To maintain contact with and support Coaches between assignments.
* To take advantage of current technology as it applies to the game of basketball.
* To provide an inclusive forum for the growth and improvement of the NBA Coaches profession.

**Major Responsibilities:**

* Assist in management of day-to-day legal and business operations of the NBCA.
* Manage critical, highly confidential, personal and proprietary information with discretion and confidentiality.
* Manage diverse commercial, marketing, and promotional activity including oversight of contract management, group licensing, events, and promotional activity.
* Drive data and financial analysis around maximizing salary, incentives, benefits and marketing opportunities for NBCA members.
* Develop presentation materials that include qualitative and quantitative analysis.
* Develop professional documents/presentations/newsletters that are engaging and informative to NBCA members, the media and strategic partners around the NBA.
* Manage multiple projects in a deadline driven environment.
* Serve as liaison in responding to internal and external requests.
* Produce creative content for website copy and social media.
* Perform independent project-based work and other duties as assigned.

**Required Skills/Knowledge/Education:** 

* Bachelor’s Degree required. JD or MBA preferred.
* Minimum 4+ years of relevant work experience, advising or supporting senior management or key company leaders.
* Experience in labor and employment matters and/or the sports & entertainment industry preferred.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (i.e. Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Experience with Canva or Adobe preferred.
* This role requires a strong sense of loyalty, decisiveness, reliability and dedication. Excellent judgment, decision making, time management, and prioritizing skills. Energetic, positive, outgoing, and inventive are ideal traits of the successful candidate.
* Excellent research, analytical, and creative problem-solving skills.
* Superb attention to detail, proofreading, communication and organizational skills.
* Ability to make independent decisions and to work with minimal direction.

**Equal Opportunity Employer:** 

The NBCA is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. The NBCA considers applicants for all positions on the basis of merit, qualification and business needs, and without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, gender, identity, age, disability, alienage or citizenship status, ancestry, marital status, creed, genetic predisposition or carrier status, sexual orientation, veteran status, familial status, status as a victim of domestic violence or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

For more on the NBA Coaches Association visit: http://www.nbacoaches.com

title: HR & Payroll Generalist - 6 Months Full Time Role - REMOTE!!
description:
**HR/Payroll Generalist**



THE RIGHT CANDIDATE



We’re looking for a creative, collaborative, resourceful, thoughtful, smart, entrepreneurial team member who has a passion for our mission and shares our values. The right candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment, celebrate winning as a team and be resourceful in finding, creating and implementing solutions. They will balance moving swiftly and thoroughly while ensuring that they are contributing to our collaborative team environment. They will care equally about achieving excellent results and ensuring everyone involved feels a valued part of the team. This person will be a key ambassador for our company.



The successful candidate is a quick learner who will seek first to understand, work with the current team to get up to speed, utilize and synthesize work that has already been done to get up to speed quickly in the business. They must be comfortable in a start-up environment and thrive on finding creative solutions. There is no playbook outside of the mission we share and the values we embrace.


**ROLE**



This role is responsible for supporting TMRW’s population. This position administer assistance to our employee payroll and HR programs. The right person will be detail-oriented, comfortable in an "all hands-on deck" environment. This role is fully remote


**OUR EXPECTATONS OF YOU**


* Day-to-day management of the payroll and benefit programs, both in the U.S. and internationally
* Prepare HR reports as needed
* Ensure all account balances are correct and in compliance
* Work with payroll administrator UKG to resolve any payroll issues
* Work and collaborate with various vendors
* Be the primary resource for employees with payroll inquiries or concerns
* Oversee the onboarding process through our HRIS System, ensuring the process is smooth for all entering employees
* Handle confidential matters with discretion
* You will use our candidate tracking system to effectively track the interview process and ensure data integrity at every step

  



You must be an enterprising self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, and focused on flawless execution. You will work closely with our Accounting & Finance team for payroll reports


**WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO SUCCEED**


* BA/BS Degree in relevant discipline or equivalent work experience required
* The ideal candidate will have 3+ years of experience working in payroll and HR operations and Benefits
* Preferred but not required: International payroll experience
* Background in HR Operations
* A thinker and problem solver
* Experience working cross-functionally with demonstrated collaboration skills
* High level of attention to detail required
* Advanced Excel skills preferred
* 2+ years of experience with UKG required
* Comfort working at a very fast pace, in ambiguity, and amid the scrappiness of an early-stage startup environment
* Speak comfortably in a variety of settings
* You’re an excellent verbal and written communicator, with an appropriate blend of integrity and friendliness
* Understanding of healthcare and fertility industry a bonus
* You are a curious collaborator and strong team player

  



ABOUT US



TMRW Life Science’s mission to safeguard life’s most precious cells. We design technology that provides safety and transparency to modernize and transform IVF. Our platform revolutionizes the management, identification, tracking, storage and care of frozen eggs and embryos used in IVF. Developed in partnership with leading fertility doctors and embryologists, TMRW’s technology will play a central role in the births of tens of millions of people in the coming years by setting a new standard of care in the IVF industry.



Our team includes many pioneering leaders in clinical medicine, reproductive biology, embryology, and cryogenic biobanking who have synthesized their collective knowledge, vision, and experience in the development of the TMRW platform. We’re committed to bringing together a diverse, cross-disciplinary team to achieve our mission — and we’re always looking for more innovators to join us in creating a better tomorrow.



At TMRW, we know that cultivating diversity and fostering an inclusive work environment is critical to our impact and success. We create an environment where no individual is advantaged or disadvantaged because of their background. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.



With a commitment to maintaining a bias-free environment where harassment is prohibited, we respect cultural diversity and comply with the laws of the places we operate. We expect our business partners, suppliers, clients, and team members to uphold these commitments.



We look for people who share our values. They are our promise to each other and the guideposts for our day-to-day work.

  



Our TMRW values:


**Integrity** is our non-negotiable.


**Excellence** is our standard.


**Collaboration** is how we win.


**Trailblazing** is our spirit.


**Service** is our passion.


**Care** is at the heart of everything we do.

  



EEO Statement


**Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Dry Needling Acupuncturist
description:
Morningside Acupuncture specializes in treating pain, sports injuries, and physical manifestations of stress by combining traditional acupuncture with dry needling.

We are looking for a licensed acupuncturist that specializes in dry needling and sports acupuncture to join our growing team. We pride ourselves on providing a great patient experience, patient education, and highly effective treatments.

We are looking for passionate candidates that have experience treating pain and and myofascial trigger points, as most of our patients primarily come in for some sort of pain.

We also treat physical manifestations of stress - like digestive and sleep issues, headaches, and depression/anxiety. The ability to integrate multiple treatment styles is very important.

We are looking for committed, self-motivated, and organized candidates with strong communication skills that would like to earn private practice compensation without the headache of maintaining their own practice. Candidates must have great time management skills, be self motivated, and be open to learning new styles of treatment.

The position will start as a part time opportunity requiring 10-20 hours per week, but can grow into a full time role of 30-40 hours per week. Compensation includes a base hourly pay plus pay per patient. The compensation structure is at the high end for licensed acupuncturists in Manhattan and it possible to make six figures in 4 days a week of treating patients (eventually).

This position requires a multi-year commitment. If you are currently in private practice or employed as an acupuncturist elsewhere, you should be open to transitioning to working solely at Morningside Acupuncture.

We prefer candidates with at least two years of experience.

We are an out-of-network provider with all insurance companies. If you are in-network with any insurance companies please do not apply for this position.

Requirements:

* Valid New York State acupuncture license
* High level of skill in trigger point dry needling
* Current malpractice insurance
* Current NCCAOM board certification
* Valid NPI provider number
* Masters degree in acupuncture (herbs optional)
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* High attention to detail and organizational skills
* Ability to work some weekend hours
* Strong hands on skills including palpation and needling
* 2+ years of experience as a licensed acupuncturist
* Knowledge of dry needling and myofascial trigger points
* Experience working with athletes

Responsibilities:

* Perform thorough patient evaluation and explain treatment plan and goals of treatment
* Provide effective and comfortable acupuncture and dry needling treatments for a wide range of conditions
* Clean and disinfect treatment room after each visit
* Maintain treatment notes and patient charts in EHR system
* Responsible for scheduling new and follow up visits
* Greet patients and collect payment at the end of each visit
* Provide information to generate superbills for out-of-network patients
* Build referral network to grow patient base
* Engage in marketing and business development tasks

More information about the practice can be found at www.morningsideacupuncturenyc.com

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $50.00 - $150.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 30 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Medical Specialty:

* Holistic Medicine
* Pain Medicine
* Sports Medicine

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities
* Commission pay

Application Question(s):

* Please describe how acupuncture works in 3 sentences or less:
* What conditions are your favorite to treat?
* What conditions do you not like to treat?
* Are you in-network with any insurance companies?
* Do you have a private practice?

If Yes - please list the name, website, and days/hours you work there.

* Why do you want to work at Morningside Acupuncture?
* Please list 3 or more muscles you would consider treating for low back pain:
* Please list 3 or more muscles you would consider treating for anterior shoulder pain:
* Please list 3 or more muscles you would consider treating for headaches:
* Please list 3 or more muscles you would consider treating for IT band pain:
* What is your experience with trigger point dry needling? Please list any trainings, courses, or certifications.

License/Certification:

* Acupuncture License (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Video Producer and Studio Supervisor, Supervising Associate
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. **Location:** New York

 **Video Producer, Supervising Associate**

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


As a member of our US Creative Services team, you’ll be joining a high-performing in-house creative agency with a digital-first focus in a culture that is agile and inspires you to be your best self every day. On our highly collaborative team, you can combine your energy, vision, creative ideas and passion for continuous learning in a flexible, virtual, diverse work environment. You’ll be working across multiple industries developing innovative solutions that help drive our clients’ business in a world that never stands still.

 **The opportunity**


As an experienced creative producer, you are a leader who influences imaginative thinking and contributes to strategic visions that help our clients solve their most complex business challenges with innovative solutions. You’ll leverage your experiences as a creative storyteller to persuade your internal clients to choose a unique, innovative, useful and memorable outcome. You’ll advance the work by drawing on vast experience and knowledge, settling for nothing less than exceptional.


You’ll be part of an expansive and talented team working independently and collaboratively. You’ll be empowered to learn and grow together with other creative minds. Your contributions and ideas will be valued and heard, and you’ll have opportunities to innovate and take part in efforts that advance our creative team.

  



**Your key responsibilities**


You can expect to lead and manage complex video/audio projects through the full development and production lifecycle including planning, budgeting, storyboarding, concepting, scripting and execution of audio and video production and publishing. You’ll be strategizing and consulting with internal clients to understand their message and assist them in transforming their content into a visual medium of animation or video that effectively conveys their strategic business objectives. You’ll lead high-level, complex video/audio projects, develop and manage detailed project plans and budgets, edit and utilize existing video footage as well as direct the creation of new footage. You’ll be conducting video interviews with internal clients and coaching senior leaders on camera performance. You’ll support all levels of the organization during the video experience, including coaching “C” suite executives and put subjects at ease to elicit the best possible experience during the entire video shoot.


You’ll be the creative lead supervising the daily operations of the New York City video studio including creating an exceptional client experience and managing studio facility operations to ensure optimal functioning and presentation of the studio. You’ll interface with clients and internal talent on set to maximize creative output and elevate the level of studio projects. Serve as the lead for webcasting technologies and studio production while leading high-level, complex video/audio shoots, and developing detailed project plans. You’ll direct and supervise creative personnel onsite and remotely. You’ll be leading, coaching, and mentoring project team members in producing creative and innovative deliverables that meet internal client demands and expectations.

 **Skills and attributes for success**

* Ability to proactively foster exceptional client relationships to build trust and collaboration that leads to the co-development of new opportunities.
* Strong business acumen to fully comprehend stakeholders’ strategic vision and influence the development and creation of the video
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to model by example
* Ability to lead and drive innovation and creativity from diverse project teams and colleagues across the country
* Superb communication skills, active listening and diplomacy when working with internal team members and business partners
* Excellent project management, team building, and interpersonal communications skills, conflict resolution and negotiation skills within a creative environment

 **To qualify for the role, you must have**

* Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent training and work experience in video production/post-production
* Creative, digital portfolio demonstrating outstanding conceptual thinking and design skills
* Eight years as a video producer with studio supervision experience (as a studio director, production manager, video producer/editor) supervising and directing creative talent and interviewing and coaching “C” suite executives
* 4 years of experience managing studio personnel and operations
* Corporate video production experience in a fast-paced environment, preferably in a financial services organization
* Advanced knowledge of video/digital production, editing, motion graphics and sound mixing techniques
* Strong understanding of live studio production technologies, including directing multicamera switched video productions, live multicamera webcasts in studio and on location, video switchers, studio lighting, sets/backgrounds and audio
* Technical excellence in operating various types of video and DSLR cameras, lenses, lighting and sound equipment with the ability to direct the right shot for the project
* Advanced understanding of various audio/video editing software such as: Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere, Adobe Encoder, Final Cut Pro
* Ability to rapidly learn new technologies on a frequent basis and guide others to do the same
* Ability to build relationships with the highest level of leadership, to skillfully liaison between groups of people to bring positive solutions that meet business objectives

 **Ideally, you’ll also have**

* Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools, Adobe Creative Suite, and Workfront
* Experience working and mentoring in a virtual environment

 **What we look for**


Engaging communicators with executive presence and the ability to influence clients and colleagues to bring their creative vision to life. We welcome creative minds who thrive on continuous learning and have a passion for innovation and keeping current with digital trends.

  

**What we offer**

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary range for this job in all geographic locations in the US is $71,100 to $133,000. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $85,300 to $151,100. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Join us in our team-led and leader-enabled hybrid model. Our expectation is for most people in external, client serving roles to work together in person 40-60% of the time over the course of an engagement, project or year. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
* **Continuous learning:** You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* **Success as defined by you:** We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* **Transformative leadership:** We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* **Diverse and inclusive culture:** You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.



EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. **If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.**

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.  

  

For those living in California, please click here for additional information.

EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.

EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities including veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during any part of the application process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, select Option 2 for candidate related inquiries, then select Option 1 for candidate queries and finally select Option 2 for candidates with an inquiry which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team (TSS) or email the TSS at ssc.customersupport@ey.com

title: Solution Architect - Technology Consulting - Financial Services - Manager Consultant - NYC
description:
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.  

Technology Consulting, Financial Services Manager - Solution Architect: Primary location for this role is in NY.

  

EY is the only professional services firm with a separate business unit (“FSO”) that is dedicated to the financial services marketplace. Our FSO teams have been at the forefront of every event that has reshaped and redefined the financial services industry. If you have a passion for rallying together to solve the most complex challenges in the financial services industry, come join our dynamic FSO team!

  

You’ll get to work on cutting edge disruptive technologies and assist with building and implementing new technology solutions and products to address challenges faced by the banking industry.

  

The opportunity


Our Financial Risk Technology practice helps clients manage credit, market and liquidity risk across regions and regulatory regimes. We provide full lifecycle services to enable the implementation of best practice risk management processes and systems. We help clients respond to emerging risk and regulatory developments through implementing agile methodologies.

  

The Financial Risk Technology practice focus areas include:

* Credit risk technology solutions - Technology solutions to complex credit risk, capital issues and regulatory mandates including but not limited to credit origination and approval, portfolio management, rating systems, Basel, CCAR Banking Book, IFRS 9, CECL, and SCCL.

  



* Treasury risk technology solutions - Establishing a strategic treasury risk architecture and framework that supports changing regulatory requirements enables the implementation of Liquidity Risk (including Intra-day), Funds Transfer Pricing, and Collateral Management solutions.

  



* Trading and market risk technology solutions - Streamlining trading technology environments and implementing flexible and reliable risk platforms including front office based market risk and VAR platform strategy, stress testing analytics, PnL decomposition and regulatory mandates including but not limited to FRTB and CCAR Trading Book.

  

Your key responsibilities

* Lead the development of cutting-edge disruptive technologies and assist with building and implementing new technology solutions and products to address liquidity challenges faced by the banking industry
* Collaborate with clients to understand their business needs and technical requirements.
* Design and architect scalable, reliable, and secure solutions that meet client objectives.
* Provide guidance and expertise to development teams throughout the project lifecycle.
* Conduct technical reviews and assessments to identify areas for improvement
* Deliver exceptional client service by recognizing potential risks and recommending solutions for effective management
* Coach and manage a team of junior level professionals with diverse skills and backgrounds
* Develop and maintain influential long-term relationships with client’s key influencers/decision makers and cultivate business development opportunities.
* Participate in pre-sales activities, including solution demonstrations and presentations.

  

Skills and attributes for success

* Your financial and risk background will enable you to build and deliver practical, executable plans that enable client success
* Stay abreast of current business and industry trends relevant to the client's business
* Drive high-quality work products within expected timeframes and on budget.
* Constantly developing your understanding of current market trends and processes and sharing your knowledge to develop junior colleagues
* Understanding our clients’ unique ambitions and needs and referring them to colleagues in other teams and areas to broaden our business relationships where possible
* Strong knowledge of and experience in executing controls related assessments across multiple risk and regulatory domains throughout the technology architecture
* Demonstrated experience in end-to-end and UAT testing of business processes, technology, and data infrastructures

  

 To qualify for the role you must have

* A Bachelor's degree (computer science, engineering, or related field) and a minimum of 5 years of related work experience in an Information Technology role in a financial services company OR
* A Master’s degree (computer science, engineering, or related field) and approximately 4 years of related work experience in a financial services company
* Demonstrated ability to manage, supervise and build a team of technology advisors through requirements definition, controls implementation, and testing
* Experience in managing small to mid-sized teams and overseeing projects from inception to deployment
* Experience in financial risk management combined with leading enterprise IT implementations leveraging Agile methodologies
* Deep understanding of regulatory reporting requirements and experience in designing solutions to meet them.
* Ability to innovate and adapt to a rapidly changing client landscape and develop/enhance EY services to meet new demands
* Experience with packages/vendors used in risk management including but not limited to Blueprism, Pega, WorkFusion, Oracle, Axiom, SAS, IBM/Algorithmics, Sungard, Moody’s, QRM, MarkIt, Bloomberg,
* Experience working with cloud-based technologies such as IaaS (AWS, GCP), DBaaS(DynamoDB, Cosmos DB), CaaS (Azure Kubernetes service, Amazon Elastic Kubernetes service) and familiarity with OpenAI technologies such as advance machine learning models like GPT and DALL-E.
* Prior consulting experience with a Big 4 firm or large global bank is preferred
* Understand leading practices and regulatory guidance in Treasury governance, processes, procedures and internal control environment
* Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.

  

Technical Skillset

* Enterprise IT implementation experience leveraging Agile and/or Waterfall methodologies
* Hands-on experience in one or more phases of the software development life cycle (SDLC), including requirements definition, architecture design, configuration, and testing
* Working knowledge of Data structures and Algorithms as well as hands-on experience with OOP Programming languages (Java preferable)
* Databases experience in MongoDB, DynamoDB
* Multi-threading in Java (with frameworks such as Akka)
* Big data technologies like Hadoop and PySpark
* Distributed computing experience over a large compute grid
* Queuing Technologies such as Apache Kafka or Crank up the AMPS etc.
* Working knowledge of C++
* Familiarity with networking protocols and ability to debug network performance issues
* Familiarity with various caching technologies such as Crank up the AMPS, Redis etc.
* Front end experience with React, Javascript
* Cloud experience with AWS, Azure or GCP


Architecture Skillset :


* Knowledge of design patterns, best practices and frameworks such as MVC, Microservices, Event-driven and Layered architecture
* Proficiency in using CI/CD tools like Jenkins, Gitlab, CircleCI
* Knowledge of container technologies like Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes
* Skills in API design and management
* Experience with middleware platforms
* Skills in optimizing applicatiions and infrastructure for scalability and performance, including load testing and tuning

  

What we look for


We’re seeking a highly motivated Manager to manage client engagement teams and lead business development activities on our strategic accounts.

  

What We Offer


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Plus, we offer:


* Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
* Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
* Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
* Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

  

About EY


As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

Join us in building a better working world.

  



Apply now.

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $128,400 to $235,400. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $154,100 to $267,500. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.

title: Bakery PHOTO CAKE SPECIALIST
description:
Stew Leonard’s, a family-owned and operated fresh food store founded in 1969, has locations in Connecticut, New York, and New Jersey. Stew’s earned its nickname, the “Disneyland of Dairy Stores” because of its country-fair atmosphere, with costumed characters and animated entertainment throughout the store that keep children entertained while parents shop.
  
  

Photo Cake Specialist
  
Part Time Hourly – Estimated pay range $17.15 to $19 depending on qualifications and experience
  
Must be at least 18 years and older
  
  

**Position Description:**  

With an attention for detail, Photo Cake Specialists decorate cakes, cupcakes, and other desserts according to standards and customer preferences.
  
  

**What you bring to the team:**  

* Provide excellent customer service, including greeting customers, responding to questions, and taking special orders
* Assist customers with design decisions
* Fulfillment of special orders
* Icing, decorating, packaging, labeling, and pricing products for retail cases
* Maintain, fill, and rotate products for quality, freshness and proper date
* Ensure work area is clean at end of shift
* Train other team members, as needed
* Adhere to all health, sanitation, and safety regulations
* Assist in other duties, as assigned


**Qualifications:**  

* Entry level position: no prior experience required
* Safely use knives, spatula, piping bags and tips
* Artistic/Design skills
* Basic computer skills
* Great customer service
* Good communication, both written and oral


**What you bring to the team:**  

* Great work ethic
* Problem solver
* Self-motivator
* Active listener
* Flexible
* Honest


**Working Conditions:**  

* Position requires walking, standing, bending, lifting, and carrying up to 50 pounds
* Duties include repetitive arm and hand movements


**Satisfy:**  

* Greet customers with a friendly smile and positive attitude, ensuring that each customer feels welcome and appreciated.


**Teamwork:**  

* Collaborate with team members to ensure the smooth operation of the store, offering assistance and support where needed.


**Excellence:**  

* Improve and maintain the efficiency of the store in order to reach success.


**Wow:**  

* Be a positive ambassador for the store, representing our S.T.E.W. values in all interactions with customers and team members. You are the biggest WOW!


Why you’ll love working here!
  
  

**Family Oriented:** We respect the personal balance between work and family with career opportunity and growth- over 80% of our managers have been promoted from within.
  
  

**Benefits:** High value, high quality Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, 401 K plan for FT & PT team members, family & personal time, life insurance, and more!
  
  

**Environment:** Have you seen the Avocado Girls? Chiquita Banana? Or the singing Parrot?
  
  

**Pay Day:** We’re thrilled to offer our employees Dayforce Wallet – a new way to get paid. Say bye-bye to pay day and hello to pay your way. Get your pay as soon as you earn it, at no cost to you – It’s your money, why should you have to wait? Request your pay as you earn it.
  
  

We take pride in the power of diversity, inclusion, and being socially responsible to the communities which we live and do business
  
  

Apply today and start as soon as 1 week!
  
  

For more information on working at Stew Leonard’s click on the link below!
  
http://www.stewleonards.com/work-at-stews/
  
  

Stew Leonard's is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

title: Parent Coordinator
company: New York City Department of Education
description:
* **Establish parent workshops on a monthly basis**
* **Work with the community to help support the school**

title: Computer Programmer Internship
description:
**Overview**  
We are seeking a skilled Computer Programmer to join our dynamic team. Nap York, strategically located in Manhattan, New York, provides on-demand sleep stations to recharge the people who power the world. We are on a mission to revolutionize the hospitality industry by offering affordable and on-demand accommodation to all.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software development and programming languages.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for writing, testing, and maintaining the detailed instructions that computers follow to perform specific tasks.

**Responsibilities**  
- Develop high-quality software design and architecture  
- Identify, prioritize, and execute tasks in the software development life cycle  
- Develop tools and applications by producing clean, efficient code  
- Automate tasks through appropriate tools and scripting  
- Review and debug code  
- Perform validation and verification testing  
- Collaborate with internal teams to fix and improve software

**Experience**  
- Proficiency in C++, Java, C#, Ruby on Rails, Python  
- Experience in web development and RESTful services  
- Knowledge of Agile methodologies  
- Understanding of IT infrastructure  
- Familiarity with C programming

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $1.00 per day

Experience:

* REST: 1 year (Preferred)
* Java: 1 year (Preferred)

* New York, NY 10011 (Preferred)
