title: Manager, Financial Operations, CPA – Population Health
description:
**Manager, Financial Operations, CPA–** Population Health

**THE BEST CAREERS.** RIGHT HERE

@ BROOKLYN’S LEADING HEALTHCARE SYSTEM**.**

**MAIMONIDES: TOP TEN IN THE U.S. FOR CLINICAL OUTCOMES**

We’re Maimonides Health, Brooklyn’s largest healthcare system, serving over 250,000 patients each year through the system’s 3 hospitals, 1800 physicians & healthcare professionals, and more than 80 community-based practices and outpatient centers.

**The Maimonides Department of Population Health aims to improve the health of the Brooklyn community through transformation of the health care delivery system and the development of processes to support integration, coordination, and collaboration across a wide range of health and social services organizations. Functioning as a Central Services Organization (CSO), the department provides support to primary care, care management, and community-based partners, and is responsible for the management of Community Care of Brooklyn IPA, Inc., Brooklyn Health Home, LLC, and Brooklyn Communities Collaborative, Inc., entities whose work is consistent with the goals of the NYS Delivery System Reform Incentive Payment (DSRIP) program. The Department of Population Health is also an academic hub supporting health services research, program evaluation, and the dissemination of new knowledge about integrated delivery systems**.

Reporting to the VP, Population Health Operations, the **Manager, Financial Operations** will support department programs as a junior staff accountant. Responsibilities include updating financial statements, monitoring accounts, maintaining accounts receivable and accounts payable, and preparing financial reports in coordination with the department Controller, MMC Finance, and a third-party financial administrator.

**Specifically, you will:**

* Coordinate with each department entity to prepare, process, and analyze balance sheets, income statements, and other financial statements weekly and/or monthly.
* Handle the month-end and year-end closing process.
* Understand department programs and revenue streams to support the budgeting process and provide financial modeling.
* Support the annual fiscal auditing process in coordination with a third-party auditor.
* Issue and prepare invoices.
* Manage accounts payable and receivables.
* Perform reconciliations.
* Post and process journal entries to ensure accurate recording of business transactions.
* Develop and measure Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and prepare reports.

title: Product Owner - Strategic Revenue Management
description:
**Job Description:**


The Product Owner oversees the product vision and its adaptation to shifting market dynamics and evolving customer needs. Primary responsibilities also include prioritization of features roadmap, validation of business outcomes of products, and monitoring of adoption and value delivered. The Product Owner works in close collaboration with a Digital Product Manager, who is in charge of providing the technical expertise, steering the overall technical delivery of the products and managing the allocation of digital resources across products & features.

**What are we looking for?**

* Minimum of a BA/BS. MBA, advanced degree, or comparable advanced experience a plus
* Strong track record in digital product management, with a proven ability to steer digital product development from concept to deployment. Recognized for ensuring products meet strategic business goals, market demands, and quality standards
* Proven expertise in strategic digital product planning and execution, including agile methodologies. Skilled in leading product teams and driving the orchestration, development & deployment of the product within cross-functional teams seamlessly
* Robust understanding of the Promotion & Trade Terms SRM lever (incl. understanding of the strategic & operational Impacts of price-value decisions, experience in monitoring and analyzing market brand Promotion & Trade Terms)
* Strong communication skills, able to translate complex product information into actionable instructions for the development team & provide clear updates for senior business stakeholders
* Robust understanding of databases (internal & external), data modelling / visualisation & AI tools for Promotion & Trade Terms
* Ability to identify opportunities to leverage data / analytics application to create business value, and to identify the most relevant analysis to approach a Promotion & Trade Terms business question
* In-depth knowledge of top quartile Promotion & Trade Terms digital products

**What will be your key responsibilities?**

* Define product vision and roadmap
* Lead product development and delivery
* Manage prioritization of product features
* Drive tool adoption and usage
* Communicate impact and value

**What can you expect from Mars?**

* Work with over 140,000 diverse and talented Associates, all guided by the Five Principles.
* Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
* Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
* An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.


Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Director, Investor Relations
description:
**Job Description**

**Position Description:**

**Director, Investor Relations**


The Investor Relations (IR) team serves as the interface between our Company and the investment community, working regularly with executive management to communicate our Company’s key messages about strategy, performance and outlook in a consistent, credible and strategic manner while monitoring and sharing the views of the investment community to senior leaders.  

  

This individual will be responsible for collaborating with the IR team in developing and executing the global investor relations program. This will include helping develop corporate messages, presentations and analyses in support of quarterly earnings, investor conferences, medical meetings and other investor engagements. This individual is expected to serve as a liaison for day-to-day inquiries from investors and sell-side analysts, and monitor and analyze trading data, industry trends, and peer company performance. To perform these activities, this individual will need to collaborate across multiple functional areas in the company to ensure alignment in messages for external audiences.  

  

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:**

* Ensure investors and analysts have an accurate depiction of the company by effectively developing and communicating our Company messages about strategy, performance and outlook through written materials and in virtual and live engagements. This includes addressing questions from investors and analysts in a professional and compliant manner.
* Work with the IR team in collaboration with others in the organization to:


	+ Develop written materials, such as key messages and Q&A for use on quarterly earnings calls, investor conferences, medical meetings and other key investor engagements.
	+ Develop appropriate strategies for analyst discussions in preparation for and in reaction to earnings releases and other significant events.
	+ Understand potential changes to budgets and forecasts and proactively assess potential impact from IR perspective.
	+ Perform adhoc analysis as needed to ensure an understanding of key metrics and drivers for the Company and how these compare to sell-side and buy-side perceptions.
* Ensure IR team is appropriately prepared to communicate key messages associated with medical conferences, data publications and other events of interest to investment community.
* Maintain comprehensive knowledge of our Company’s products, pipeline, business, financials, competitors and financial markets to assist in representing our Company to investment community.

**Position Qualifications****:**

**Education Minimum Requirement:**

* Batchelor's Degree

**Required Experience and Skills:**

* Unwavering team orientation in pursuit of IR team/our Company’s achievement of success.
* Strong work ethic with high energy and an insatiable appetite to learn.
* Superior ability to absorb, comprehend, interpret and synthesize large amounts of data and information.
* Strong ability to think at enterprise level, anticipate events and resolve challenges.
* Strong interpersonal and relationship management skills.
* Outstanding oral and written communication skills with ability to effectively present to large audiences.
* Analytically minded with ability to comprehend and communicate detailed financial, product and scientific information.
* Understanding of the financial modeling techniques used by security analysts to project a company's operating and financial performance and determine valuation for its stock.
* Understanding of and curiosity about global financial markets.
* Aptitude for science and curiosity about research pipelines of our Company and peers.
* Ability to perform duties in a fast-paced, oftentimes stressful and uncertain environment, with tight time deadlines.
* Ability to effectively work within cross-functional teams.
* Willingness and ability to travel (approximately 10-20%) and to work mostly in-office.

**NOTICE****FOR****INTERNAL****APPLICANTS**


In accordance with Managers' Policy - Job Posting and Employee Placement, all employees subject to this policy are required to have a minimum of twelve (12) months of service in current position prior to applying for open positions.

  

If you have been offered a separation benefits package, but have not yet reached your separation date and are offered a position within the salary and geographical parameters as set forth in the Summary Plan Description (SPD) of your separation package, then you are no longer eligible for your separation benefits package. To discuss in more detail, please contact your HRBP or Talent Acquisition Advisor.

**Employees working in roles that the Company determines require routine collaboration with external stakeholders, such as customer-facing commercial, or research-based roles, will be expected to comply not only with Company policy but also with policies established by such external stakeholders (for example, a requirement to be vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to access a facility or meet with stakeholders). Please understand that, as permitted by applicable law, if you have not been vaccinated against COVID-19 and an essential function of your job is to call on external stakeholders who require vaccination to enter their premises or engage in face-to-face meetings, then your employment may pose an undue burden to business operations, in which case you may not be offered employment, or your employment could be terminated. Please also note that, where permitted by applicable law, the Company reserves the right to require COVID-19 vaccinations for positions, such as in Global Employee Health, where the Company determines in its discretion that the nature of the role presents an increased risk of disease transmission.**

title: Housekeeping Supervisor
description:
**Gansevoort Hotel is looking for an experienced Housekeeping Supervisor.** 

**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Housekeeping Supervisor to oversee the housekeeping operations within our establishment. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in housekeeping management, within the hotel or hospitality industry. This role is essential for maintaining high standards of cleanliness and organization, ensuring guest satisfaction, and leading a team of housekeeping staff.

**Responsibilities**  
- Manage and coordinate all housekeeping activities to ensure cleanliness and orderliness throughout the facility.  
- Develop and implement cleaning schedules and procedures to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.  
- Train, supervise, and evaluate housekeeping staff to maintain high performance standards.  
- Conduct regular inspections of guest rooms, public areas, and back-of-house spaces to ensure compliance with cleanliness standards.

- Act as office coordiantor and respond to all incoming calls.  
- Collaborate with other departments to address maintenance issues and enhance overall guest experience.  
- Maintain inventory of cleaning supplies and equipment; order supplies as needed while adhering to budgetary guidelines.  
- Ensure adherence to safety protocols and proper handling of cleaning chemicals.  
- Address guest complaints or concerns promptly to ensure satisfaction.

**Experience**  
- Proven experience in housekeeping management within the hotel or hospitality sector is required.  
- Familiarity with custodial practices, industrial cleaning techniques, and floor care is highly desirable.  
- Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and manage a diverse team effectively.  
- Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail in maintaining cleanliness standards.  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple priorities.  
- Strong communication skills for effective interaction with guests and team members alike.

Join our team as a Housekeeping Manager where your expertise will contribute significantly to creating a welcoming environment for our guests!

title: Analyst Social Media
description:
**Position Summary**


The Analyst, Social Media will report to the Manager of Social Media and is passionate about travel, internet culture and analytics. To help drive our social media strategy, you will assist in conceptualizing creative content, delivering thorough creative feedback, and execute measurable initiatives to elevate awareness, engagement and growth across our social media channels amongst customers and non-customers of JetBlue. You will collaborate cross-functionally, building and maintaining relationships with individuals within and outside of the organization. The role requires an effective communicator who is analytical and is comfortable working in an ever-changing environment parallel to the world of social media, ready to make a mark on the internet through their creativity.

  



**Essential Responsibilities**

 **Creative**

* Coordinate the creation production and execution of social media content, managing link maintenance, video descriptions, verifying tagging, proofread copy and editing, and more
* Ensure creative content delivery is timely and accurate, meeting deadlines
* Be a trend-spotter, ascending notable trends within the Marketing department and delegate to our creative agency for proactive and reactive opportunities
* Contribute creative ideas, inclusive but not limited to brand/influencer partnerships, to share with our internal and external partners to drive strong integration and alignment with social and content strategies
* Collaborate with the Senior Analyst and Manager of Social Media intaking creative briefs and generating ideas to drive engagement, awareness, and growth across social media channels
* Proactively support in monitoring user-generated content and cascade to external partners for potential usage

 **Analytics** 

* Lead in assessing profile and post-performance across networks to curate monthly and ad-hoc reports in effort to help meet social benchmarks and ensure the brand is meeting our respective audiences
* Support in social listening analysis and present actionable insights to key stakeholders
* Support in ad-hoc reports for key stakeholders such as our Consumer Promotions and Corporate. Communications team to pull post-performance and social listening analysis of brand announcements and key sales

 **Admin**

* Manage via our tools or natively the scheduling and publishing of social media content
* Support in updating any internal social media resources to ensure details are up to date
* Other duties as assigned

 **Minimum Experience and Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, Business, or an associated field; OR demonstrated capability to perform job responsibilities with a combination of a High School Diploma/GED and at least four (4) years of previous relevant work experience
* One (1) year of experience in Digital Marketing, Social Media Marketing, or Advertising
* Comfortable working in a fast paced environment with changing priorities and tight deadlines
* Ability to work in autonomous environment with changing priorities
* Extremely detail-oriented, critical thinker who can adapt technical content effectively in a variety of styles and tones for various platforms and audiences
* Ability to interact daily with people at different levels within the organization including developing and maintaining ongoing relationships
* Available for frequent overnight travel (40%)
* Must be in possession of valid travel documents with the ability to travel in and out of the United States
* Able to work flexible hours and be available for an emergency response on short notice
* Must pass a pre-employment drug test
* Must be legally eligible to work in the country in which the position is located
* Authorization to work in the US is required. This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship

 **Preferred Experience and Qualifications**

* Four (4) years’ experience in social, content, marketing or advertising
* Previous travel or airline industry experience
* Strong analytical and mathematical skills
* Experience with supporting an influencer program
* Experience with on-grounds content capture for brand activations
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong interpersonal skills, amicable and professional demeanor
* Self-starter who is eager to participate and contribute

 **Crewmember Expectations**

* Regular attendance and punctuality
* Potential need to work flexible hours, inclusive of weekends
* Able to maintain a professional appearance
* When working or traveling on JetBlue flights, and if time permits, all capable crewmembers are asked to assist with light cleaning of the aircraft
* Must be an appropriate organizational fit for the JetBlue culture, that is, exhibit the JetBlue values of Safety, Caring, Integrity, Passion and Fun
* Promote JetBlue’s #1 value of safety as a Safety Ambassador, supporting JetBlue’s Safety Management System (SMS) components, Safety Policy and behavioral standards
* Identify safety and/or security concerns, issues, incidents or hazards that should be reported and report them whenever possible and by any means necessary including JetBlue’s confidential reporting systems (Aviation Safety Action Program (ASAP) or Safety Action Report (SAR))
* The use of ChatGPT or any other automated tool during the interview process will disqualify a candidate from being considered for the position

 **Equipment**

* Computer and other office equipment

  



**Work Environment**

* Traditional office environment

 **Physical Effort**

* Moderate physical effort required by handling objects up to 40 pounds occasionally and/or up to 10 pounds frequently. (Light)

 **Compensation**

* The base pay range for this position is between $62,400.00 and $89,600.00 per year. Base pay is one component of JetBlue’s total compensation package, which may also include access to healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan and company match, crewmember stock purchase plan, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, free space available travel on JetBlue, and more

*(Bilingual South Asian/English preferred)*

**Hiring Range: $75,000 - $110,000**

**Serving Others is Our Passion:** As a growing member of the community for more than 90 years, Flushing Bank is dedicated to supporting and serving the individuals, families, professionals, and businesses in Brooklyn, Queens, Manhattan, and on Long Island.

**WE can offer YOU:** Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance, Short Term & Long Term Disability, Group Term Life, 401K Plus Employer Match, Paid Time Off, 11 Paid Holidays, Employee Referral Program, generous Incentive Programs, Volunteer Opportunities, and a Supportive Environment Focused on Learning and Advancement.

title: Mobile Phlebotomist-Per Diem
description:
**Mobile Phlebotomist- Per Diem**  

**Location: New York City**  

  

**About Sanguine:**  

Sanguine Biosciences is accelerating personalized medicine research by empowering patients with their healthcare data and making it as easy as possible for them to participate in the medical research process. We partner with patients and pharmaceutical companies to accelerate precision medicine R&D by securely and efficiently collecting and providing patient samples and relevant health data. We are helping thousands of researchers at 20 of the top 40 global pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies increase the speed and quality at which they are conducting their research. For the past three years, Sanguine received the prestigious designation as a “Great Places to Work'' company plus additional awards for leadership and diversity. It is an exciting time; our biotech company is growing quickly and needs the best team members to join us.  

  

  

**About the Role:**  

As part of Sanguine Bioscience’s patient-facing team, you are serving as the face of Sanguine during all specimen collections. It is important for Sanguine employed Phlebotomists to be comfortable and well-versed in the collection setting both on-site (if applicable) and in the field while representing Sanguine professionally and compassionately. Phlebotomists will perform a variety of protocol-specific procedures including but not limited to phlebotomy, vitals, physical exam, sample processing, packaging and shipment of applicable goods, and delivery and transport of materials per protocol. The above activities must be conducted per clinical research standards, including but not limited to IATA, HIPAA, and OSHA. Phlebotomists must be familiar with the protocol and procedures being practiced and must be fully trained before performing collections. On-site projects will also require managing Sanguine’s on-site inventory of supplies and equipment when applicable.  

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**  

**Mobile Phlebotomy and Sample Collection**
* Complete complex research visits that may include pre-mixing of kitting reagents, multiple shipments, multi-biospecimen collections, dry ice purchasing and handling, centrifuge and aliquoting, custom documentation, and same day drop-offs within a set period of time.
* Ensure that the biospecimens are collected by following the company’s policies and protocols and procedures and dropped off at their specified locations within the designated time frames.
* Collect patient medical history, vital signs, blood pressure and other potential health-related data in the home, when applicable.
* Confirm specimens are properly labeled, transported, and shipped in a timely manner.
* Ensure integrity of biospecimens by properly packaging and shipping collection materials. This may include purchasing dry ice prior to appointments and storing cold bricks in the freezer.
* Dispose of biohazard materials and containers per protocol and as scheduled.
* Review daily visit roster and patient locations prior to day of collection, confirming kit specifications for each patient and receipt of correct supplies for multiple shipments.
* Follow protocol instructions, pre-mixing reagents before visits as necessary.
* Prepare log for multiple biospecimen collections for same day deliveries.
* Maintain, manage and certify centrifuge and other company administered equipment.
* Complete centrifugation during visits which may include managing multiple samples and spins per client protocol(s), aliquoting blood components into cryovials, properly labeling all end products according to instructions, and following packaging and shipping best practices according to training and regulations.

**Communications**
* Responsible for communicating to the operations staff to ensure sufficient inventory levels and equipment maintenance.
* Work cooperatively with all patients, employees, clients, and guests.
* Report any unsafe issues or conditions per established policies and procedures.
* Maintain a high level of customer service and a focus on patient safety during all in-home and study related procedures.
* Keep an updated schedule of availability for Sanguine work for no less than two weeks at a time. This can include, but is not limited to: field appointments, training, and other duties as assigned. Be available for additional quality and study training as needed.
* Ability to collect and/or handle minimally or non-invasively collected human biospecimens that includes but is not limited to whole blood, urine, saliva, semen, stool and sputum.
* Work independently and autonomously at assigned biospecimen draw locations. Demonstrate exceptional customer service skills and provide a world-class patient experience.
* Adhere to Sanguine Biosciences' employee handbook and dress code.
* Conduct yourself professionally and compassionately with donors, employees, clients, guests, and the public.

**Position Requirements:**
* At least 2 year phlebotomy experience
* Certified Phlebotomy Technologist/Phlebotomy Technician Certificate (CPT or PTC) or similar depending on state law. Active licensure when state law applies.
* Proof of current testing/vaccinations and any additional state required immunizations per Sanguine policy.
* Familiar with and actively practice CDC phlebotomy protocol(s).
* Strong knowledge and understanding about HIPAA compliance.
* Complete all documentation following Good Documentation Practices (GDP).
* Ability to follow the provided company policies, training, and study-specific protocols and procedures for internal communication, kit management, in-home phlebotomy work, and biospecimen handling and shipping.
* This role may require being at a pharmaceutical site to make collections and follow specific scheduling instructions.
* Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail - willing to manage the supplies required for field and on-site use.
* Willingness to wear PPE.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to communicate clinical information to non-clinical people. Provide patient support and answer any questions about the visit.
* Experience using mobile technology.
* Call reminders to the patients before the appointments.
* QA documentation visit requirements.
* Ability to take blood pressure and pulses.
* Required Travel
* Must have an insured and reliable vehicle to drive
* Valid driver’s license
* Satisfactory driving record
* Satisfactory background check per company policy
* State minimum auto insurance coverage
* Punctual
* Mileage will be reimbursed at the IRS established mileage rate
* Must be willing and able to travel to locations within a 150 mile radius of your home
* Availability & Shifts
* This is an Hourly Role
* Per Diem employment will allow you to accept and decline work assignments at your leisure
* Preferred Qualifications
* Pediatric phlebotomy experience
* Geriatric phlebotomy experience
* Experience supporting clinical trials
* EKG experience
* Experience with centrifuges and pipetting
* Technology
* Skedulo
* Brex
* Everlance
* PayCor
* Google Suite

Hourly Rate: $27/hour
  

Sanguine Biosciences is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected classification. Minorities, women, LGBTQ candidates, Veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Sanguine Biosciences is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected classification. Minorities, women, LGBTQ candidates, Veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

title: Lab Supervisor
description:
At 710 Labs, our mission is simple: to disrupt the industry through obsessive quality. We believe in quality over everything – quality people, quality thinking, quality expression, quality of life. We believe in open communication and genuine collaboration where everyone has a voice. We rise together as a team and as an industry.  

  

710 Labs is an award-winning multi-state cannabis brand obsessed with making the richest flavored, organic, small batch cannabis on the planet. We are the OGs that hand select and hunt exotic cultivars from the most renowned breeders. We collaborate with artists such as Richard Prince, LSD World Peace, Astral Oracles, The Elder Statesman and Camp High among others for exclusive accessories and product drops.
This role will support the 710 Labs brand but will be employed by our New Jersey partner, Fresh Cannabis, LLC  

  

Come join us.  

  

Responsibilities include:
* Assist the Lab Director in the management of lab employees including but not limited to, supervising common tasks, tracking and holding accountable for performance metrics, assist in increasing overall awareness, skills, and performance of the team.
* Ensure all employees are accurately and effectively executing General SOPs, Production SOPs, Storage SOPs, and Transferring SOPs without deviation.
* Understanding of how to perform and operate all lab machinery and how to create all the SKUs we produce
* Ensure extraction scheduled dictated by ownership and/or management are adhered to and achieved.
* Assist Lab Director with the allocations, batching and creation of production sheets.
* Assisting Lab Director to ensure all required paperwork is completed
	+ METRC
	+ Dynamics
	+ Google Sheets/Excel
	+ Production Sheets
* Ensuring that lab supplies remain in stock at all times.
* Tracking the fresh frozen intake from harvest, the organization of the freezers, and updating any outtake/usage.
* Keep highly accurate and detailed production records.
* Ensuring all product weights, containers, and jars are accounted for.
* Upkeep of all lab equipment regardless of level - employee, sub-contractor, or manufacturer- and working with management to get any equipment needing repair or maintenance completed, if it exceeds the employee level of maintenance.
* Oversee and regulate the gramming and distribution of R&D samples.
* Assist in any R&D projects dictated by ownership and/or management and adhere to the assigned methodologies without deviation and to completion, including but not limited to, the final collection and dissemination of all results.
* QA and Tier rating of all products produced by the lab.
* Maintaining a positive supportive role for the team in leading them to success.
* Leads, guides, and communicates to employees in a professional manner.
* Perform tasks such as pre-production, post-production tasks when needed.
* Provides training and development to new and existing employees.
* Assessment of product and production path it should take.


  

Qualifications:
* 2 years prior experience in a cannabis manufacturing lab.
* Prior people management experience required.
* Excellent communication skills and leadership both verbally and through written media.
* Detail oriented with an eye on process improvement and optimization.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, to manage high-stress situations, and to be flexible and adaptable when a situation requires.
* Must be comfortable working in cold environments (30-40F) for extended periods of time.
* For extended periods, must be capable of sitting, squatting, standing, kneeling, bending, or walking through the workday.
* Experience in a production role that required time management and high standards for quality control.
* Experience solventless production - particularly processing of fresh frozen into water hash and various rosin products.
* Knowledge and ability to use & troubleshoot standard lab equipment and freeze dryers.
* Attention to detail.
* Ability to use standard office equipment, computer equipment and software including word processing, database management, METRC, spreadsheet applications and electronic mail.
* Skilled in analyzing problems, identifying alternative solutions, projecting consequences of proposed actions, and implementing recommendations in support of company philosophies and goals.
* Be able to reach set goals within a given time frame.
* Efficient at repetitive tasks.
* Work well as part of a team.


  

Please note that the regulations and laws of The State of New Jersey require persons working onsite at a cannabis facility to be at least 21 years of age.  

  

The Company is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

description:

**Job Description**
-------------------


Do you enjoy building a brand in a competitive environment? Do you excel at building and managing new existing relationships? Do you like to win? Then welcome to your new home! Here at TriStruX we are looking for a self-motivated and driven team member who can help push our vision forward and boost revenue while setting our company apart from the competition. Our ideal candidate will have existing carrier and fiber relationships with the soft and hard cost deployment teams delivering services to the local markets. This individual should be able to effectively articulate our sales approach in order to expands our services offering, strengthen client relationships, and provided continuity from our team to the deployment teams.

### **Skills and qualifications**

* Exceptional attention to detail

title: Tower Foreman
description:
**Tower Foreman**
=================


**Location: Clifton, NJ, 07011**
--------------------------------


**Company Background:**
-----------------------


Founded in 1977, TriStruX provides comprehensive turnkey telecommunications service solutions to the industry's largest wireless telecom carriers, equipment OEMs, MSOs, and tower companies. The company leverages in-house and subcontracted labor to accommodate all aspects of the telecommunications industry, focusing on telecommunication, fiber, 5G and civil installation and construction services in the largest US metro areas and more than 20 states nationally. In December 2021, the company completed an investment for majority control from Huron Capital, a Private Equity firm based in Detroit, MI. The company competes in markets leveraging an addressable market of $55B in annual wireless carrier capital spending.


**Job Summary:**
----------------


The Tower Foreman must have an expert level of understanding with all aspects of the wireless industry. The person in this position will be expected to maintain full control of his/her crews’ production and lead by example. One will utilize the Tower Lead to develop and plan out the complete build of the site. This person will verify a high quality of deliverables for SOW and will identify change orders, possible obstacles, and safety concerns, which may prevent timely completion of site work. This person will work with the supervisor to establish achievable scheduling and goals as determined by management (Construction Manager/Project Manager).


**Responsibilities:**
---------------------


* Follow all state and federal safety regulations (OSHA, local turfing vendor, Tower Co., etc.) while working in an efficient and productive manner.
* Required to work at heights installing telecom equipment/materials on towers, monopoles, etc. including mounts, radios and antennas.
* Interprets various documents (e.g. blueprints, diagrams, manufacturer specifications, etc.) to ensure proper installation of antenna systems using technical expertise and knowledge of blueprints and diagrams.
* A willingness to travel when and where required as directed by market.
* Foreman will be responsible for production reporting, hours, time off, new/damaged equipment needs, etc. to the management team
* Foreman will be responsible for the care of all crew tools, equipment, and vehicles daily.
* Foreman will be responsible for submitting all daily and weekly required paperwork (ex: JSA, weekly safety topics, crane/heavy machinery forms, etc.)

**Experience and Education:**
-----------------------------


* Successful Completion of Required Training (reference pages 14 and 123 of IIPP):
	+ Tower/Rescue COMTRAIN or equivalent
	+ NWSA TTT1 or TTT2
	+ First Aid/CPR/AED (American Red Cross or American Heart Association) must have a hands-on portion.
	+ Bloodborne Pathogens
	+ PPE use and requirements
	+ Lock out Tag out
	+ RF Awareness
	+ Competent Rigging
	+ HAZCOM/GHS (formally MSDS)
	+ Special equipment (aerial lift, forklift, backhoe, capstan, etc.)
	+ OSHA30 Training
* Minimum of two years of tower and telecommunications experience.
* Experience with capstan operations.
* Experience with crane/signaling.


This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employee(s) will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. title: Facility Operations Supervisor - Long Island, NY
description:
**About:**

Collins Building Services (CBS) is proud to be a leading firm in facility management throughout the New York Tri-State area for over 30 years. Clients choose us for our commitments of superior quality service, transparency, and innovation, tailored to their individual needs. With over 3,200 employees, Collins Building Services’ operations team is responsible for providing the excellent service that has been recognized throughout the industry.

This is a unique opportunity to join an established company that is investing in constant innovation, turning customer feedback into actionable insights for business success and solutions. If you want to work for a company that’s focused on providing you the best experience with a continued focus on your personal growth and development – join the CBS Operations Team!

**Job Overview:**

The Supervisor will be responsible for overseeing the activities of the CBS housekeeping team within a retail environment. The primary responsibility is to ensure that all daily and periodic requirements are completed to the highest standards and according to schedule. Additionally, this position will also ensure that client requests are promptly addressed in order to achieve the highest level of customer satisfaction and in accordance the required standards.

**Responsibilities:**

**Team Management**

* Motivates, directs, trains and coaches all employees to meet maintenance requirements.
* Conducts quality assurance checks.
* Adheres to cleaning specifications as set forth by contractual agreements and company standards.
* Promptly manages client request and responds to client complaints.
* Conducts inspections and submits reports on a weekly basis.
* Recommends services and maintenance care to clients.
* Maintains constant communication with clients to ensure quality service.

**Inventory and Supply Management**

* Manages inventory and distributes equipment, supplies, and other materials in a cost effective and efficient manner.
* Arranges for equipment maintenance and repairs.

**Administration, Safety, Training and Other Responsibilities**

* Ensures accurate timekeeping records daily and accurately reports weekly payrolls.
* Maintains personnel calendars and documents sick, personal, holiday and other applicable records through the time and attendance system.
* Maintains safety records, investigates work related and liability incidents, reports incidents according to safety and OSHA regulations, and coordinates and conducts required safety trainings.
* Adheres to client specific administrative reports, documentation, and other requests.

**Qualifications and Competencies:**

* High School Degree required; College degree desired.
* Fluency in Spanish is highly preferred.
* 3-5 years of prior supervisory experience in a retail facilities maintenance environment or similar industry.
* Successful experience with managing, motivating, training, and coaching large teams.
* Knowledge of and ability to train on compliance for OSHA, DOH and other regulatory agencies.
* Strong relationship building skills, specifically able to build effective relationships with property management, other facility teams, client representatives, CBS staff and management.
* Experience with managing in a union environment highly desired as well as experience following union protocols.
* Able to prioritize work and elevate appropriately any obstacles or concerns.

*Collins Building Services provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants. The Company does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, creed or religion, color, national origin, sex, age, disability or handicap, marital status, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, citizenship or citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.​*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Application Question(s):

* Do you have experience working with work order and/or inspection systems?
* Are you able to work a Wednesday to Sunday, 10:00am to 7:00pm work schedule?
* Are you able to reliably commute to the Long Island region?

Experience:

* Custodial Supervisor: 3 years (Required)

* Spanish (Required)

title: Pharmacy Service Representative
description:
**InfuCare Rx** is a leading home infusion provider accredited by URAC and ACHC offering a specialized approach to caring for patients in need of IV therapy and specialty pharmacy services in the homecare setting. We have created an ethical, team oriented, and quality work environment for our employees that cultivates achievement and success. **Description:**
Reporting to the Pharmacist-In-Charge and Staff Pharmacists, the Pharmacy Service Representative will act as the patient’s advocate to ensure that the prescribed drug therapy, pharmacy assessment and pharmacy care plan are followed as prescribed and meets the medical, social, and personal needs of the patient. **Responsibilities:*** Communicates with patients to ensure proper delivery of medications (both acute, IVIG and specialty) for scheduled infusion appointments.
* During communication with patients, understand how to properly complete assessment.
* Assists with determining patient availability for the Digital designation and will assist in education for the patient on using the Digital platform.
* Ensures that patients receive notifications and understand appointment schedule.
* Responds to patient calls timely and appropriately.
* Obtains and updates necessary patient demographic and related data according to policies and procedures.
* Data enters relevant communications in progress notes of pharmacy operating system.
* Assists with picking and packing products in preparation for shipping as requested.
* Attending meetings and other functions necessary to perform duties and assist in business. development for the Company, including assisting in launching a certain data collection software.
* Perform other duties as assigned by management.
* Proficient in computer program applications, knowledge, and skills.

 **Requirements:*** Healthcare experience required
* Specialty Pharmacy and Home Infusion Services experience preferred
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite products
* Experience with information technology a plus
* Have a drive for results, competitive spirit, and self-accountability for achievement of company goals
* Clear, concise communication
* Proven success across past career positions

 **Physical Demands:**
Required to stand, walk, sit, talk, and hear; required to use hands to operate vehicles and office equipment; must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs; specific vision requirements for this job include: close, distance and peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position without compromising patient care.  

InfuCare Rx is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military status, marital status, citizenship/immigration status, sex (including pregnancy and relation conditions, sexual orientation, or gender identity), age (40 and older), disability, genetic information (including employer requests for, or purchase use, or disclosure of genetic tests, genetic services, or family medical history), retaliation for filing a charge, reasonably opposing discrimination, or participating in a discrimination lawsuit, investigation, or proceeding. Background checks and drug screens are part of our hiring process. Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.

title: Construction Analyst
company: New York Foundation for Fair Contracting
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION: CONSTRUCTION ANALYST – LOWER HUDSON VALLEY/DOWNSTATE REGION

**Mission Statement / Background:** The **New York Foundation for Fair Contracting** (“NYFFC”) is a labor-management non-profit with a mission to “level the playing field” in public works construction for the benefit of workers, responsible contractors, and taxpayers.

**Job Summary:** 

The Construction Analyst is an integral member of the NYFFC team. The Analyst supports the work of the NYFFC by monitoring the local public construction marketplace for compliance with prevailing wage and responsible contracting standards. The Analyst reports to the Senior Analysts and the Director, as needed. This position will provide critical operations and administrative support to NYFFC staff and partners.

**Responsibilities**:

● **Assist workers** in recovering unpaid wages and benefits.

● **Analyze payroll documents and contractor records** to evaluate compliance with prevailing wage laws and other rules governing construction contracts.

● **Liaise with government officials** to advance responsible contracting standards and pursue enforcement action for violations of such.

● **Track public works construction project data**.

● **Conduct industry and market research**.

● **Monitor** important changes and developments in the New York construction industry.

● **Interface and cultivate relationships** with various stakeholders.

**Qualifications:**

* Passion for issues of importance to working people.
* Excellent people skills and interest in relationship building with a variety of people and institutions.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Digital literacy with ability to adopt new systems and platforms as needed.
* Self-driven and curious with strong organizational skills.
* Knowledge of New York State and federal labor laws pertaining to the construction industry a plus.
* Familiarity with the construction industry, the legislative process, and database systems a plus.
* Position involves local travel. Must have reliable transportation.
* Minimum Experience: A bachelor’s degree or a minimum of five or more years of continued professional growth in a related field.

**Hours:** Full time, Monday through Friday. Flexible scheduling available. Position involves hybrid work and some periodic in-state and out-of-state travel.

**Salary:** $75,000 a year**.** Benefits include health insurance, dental insurance, pension, and paid time off.

**Interested persons may submit a resume or CV, and cover letter by October 31, 2024.** 

*The NYFFC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Hiring decisions are made based upon a candidate’s qualifications for the position. We are committed to an inclusive workplace free of discrimination.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Application Question(s):

* Please submit a cover letter to be considered for the position.

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Briarcliff Manor, NY 10510

title: Client Acquisition Trainee
description:
Are you determined, self-driven, and looking for a successful career to help create a cleaner planet? Do you like helping others while building relationships with your co-workers & community? We are looking for candidates who are self-starters with a student mentality to come join our fast-growing team. We train all new hires to give them the tools necessary to succeed to their highest potential. Come join our Solar Sales Team to help build toward a better future!

**Opportunities For Advancement**

We are searching for entry-level Solar Sales Team Members to help customers transition from fossil fuels to renewable, clean energy. New to Solar? No problem! No experience is required! The only requirement is a willingness to learn and a desire to exceed expectations. Training is provided by some of the top professionals in the solar industry. We provide continuous training starting day one, throughout your career here, and into any path you choose to take while with us - including leadership!

**If you want to start an exciting career while making the world a better place, we want to speak with you!**

**Opportunities For Advancement**

No sales experience? No problem! We only require that entry level associates come in with a student mentality and an eagerness to learn and grow. You’ll be trained by some of the top performers in the industry, receiving effective hands-on training. When joining the team, you’ll be given all the tools needed to branch out into the career path you see fit and maximize your potential. Be ready to work hard and play hard along our great team!

**Responsibilities**

* Speak with customers regarding solar & educate them on products or services.
* Respond to customer inquiries regarding energy programs and policies
* Acquire and develop industry knowledge
* Attend company meetings as required

**Requirements**

* Full-time availability
* A positive attitude and the ability to collaborate
* Willingness to learn
* Reliable form of transportation

**Benefits**

* Strong leadership dedicated to sales support
* Clear career path opportunities
* Team nights
* Fun, fast paced, and passionate environment

NFS is the premier provider of behavioral health services in six states. We’re growing fast and we’re looking for YOU.



Our **LGBTQIA**+ oriented team has openings for PRIDE CLINICIAN. Help us realize our dream of creating a service-based delivery team that REFLECTS the PRIDE / LGBTQIA+ COMMUNITY! This PRIDE team will provide structured, consistent, strength-based therapeutic interventions to the LGBTQIA+ community in a client’s home or in the office for the purpose of treating a youth’s behavioral health needs. We utilize multiple evidence-based practices that promote families in a culturally informed and competent way.


**Pride Clinicians** work collaboratively with clients to help them access their core strengths to be their best selves and realize their full potential, utilizing a variety of approaches such as individual, couple, family, and group psychotherapy. * Personal cell phone discount

description:
NFS is the premier provider of behavioral health services in six states. Our New York team is growing fast and looking for YOU!  

  

Our LGBTQIA+ oriented team has fee for service and full-time openings available for Youth Peer Advocates on our PRIDE team. Help us realize our dream of creating a service-based delivery team that REFLECTS the PRIDE / LGBTQIA+ COMMUNITY!  

  

This PRIDE team will provide structured, consistent, strength-based therapeutic interventions to the LGBTQIA+ community in a client’s home or in the office for the purpose of treating a youth’s behavioral health needs. The Youth Peer Advocate is someone who has self-identified as a person who has first-hand experience with social, emotional, medical, developmental, substance use, and/or behavioral challenges. They can use their lived experience with a disability, mental health challenge, substance use disorder and/or experience in juvenile justice, special education, and/or foster care to assist in supporting young people in their resiliency/recovery and wellness. We utilize multiple evidence-based practices that promote families in a culturally informed and competent way.



As part of the care team and under the direction of licensed clinicians, Youth Peer Advocates work collaboratively with clients to help them access their core strengths to be their best selves and realize their full potential, utilizing a variety of approaches such as individual, couple, family, and group psychotherapy. JOIN US AND MAKE A REAL DIFFERENCE IN THE LIVES OF CHILDREN, ADULTS, OR FAMILIES!

description:
**Northeast Family Services is seeking a Vice President (VP) of New York to support the agency’s mission and core values!**  

  

The **Vice President of New York** Operations, in partnership with the Executive and Senior Vice Presidents, will oversee services including Outpatient, In-Home therapy, Building Bridges, and other programs as they are developed and assigned within the state of New York.  

  

The VP is responsible for the effective management of services including oversight of quality, compliance, outcomes, staffing safety, service delivery and financial performance. The VP will create and implement a region-wide behavioral health system across the continuum of care and will have oversight and management responsibilities over behavioral health options. This position will be the main contact between the Executive and Senior Vice Presidents and the state’s Assistant Vice Presidents and Program Directors.



If you’re looking to make a change, don’t miss this career opportunity to join a growing, well-regarded agency dedicated to their clients and providing exceptional care!  



**VP Qualifications:**



* Master's degree in social work, psychology, counseling, or related human services field
* Independent clinical licensure: LCSW, LMHC, or Licensed Psychologist in the state of New York
* At least seven years of experience in the management of behavioral health operations in a behavioral health setting
* An in-depth working knowledge of administration and operations with a strong emphasis on, and an understanding of, financial management, strategic planning, client care, quality assessment and improvement, risk management, employee relations and human resource management
* Ability and willingness to travel throughout the state of New York; valid driver’s license with reliable and consistent access to a vehicle
* Experience with OMH regulations (Article 31 and CFTSS) is strongly preferred
* Experience with the child welfare population is strongly preferred
* Experience with networking and starting programs is strongly preferred
* Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
* Proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel
* Knowledge of Electronic Health Records (EHR)
* Understanding of New York's service array and needs of the community
* Ability to assist with the discovery and development of grants, contracts and related tasks
* Ability to manage multiple programs and/or service systems
* Bilingual Spanish preferred but not required
**Benefits:**



* 3 weeks paid vacation
* 11 Paid holidays (including Juneteenth, the day after Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, and NY Eve.)
* Generous sick time including mental health days
* 401k retirement plan with up to 4% match
* Voluntary short and long-term disability
* Voluntary Life Insurance
* Dependent care savings account
* Mileage reimbursement
* Longevity award - additional vacation day annually
* Company provided laptop and cell phone
* Opportunity for professional growth
* Personal cell phone discount
**Compensation:**



* Full Time, Salary: $115,000 - $135,000

title: Billing Specialist
description:
Northeast Family Services is currently seeking a Billing Specialist to join their growing team!



NFS is an established and growing organization with locations in 9 states that specializes in providing therapeutic services to individuals and families via telehealth, in-person, or in-home. We are currently looking for a passionate and dedicated Billing Specialist to join our team.  

  

The **Billing Specialist** is responsible for performing necessary billing and clerical duties to ensure accurate management of the practice account receivables. The Billing Specialist will work with a team to conduct a variety of daily tasks, including preparing clean and timely claims submissions, resolution of denials from payers, posting of payments into patient accounting systems, maintaining precise data, and obtaining and tracking payment information.  

  

If you’re looking to make a change, don’t miss this career opportunity to join a growing, well-regarded organization truly dedicated to their employees and clients!


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:**


* Process behavioral health billing in a timely manner
* Monitor the accuracy of submitted claims
* Verify ICD-10 / CPT coding for accuracy and make adjustments as needed
* Communicate with payers, third party vendors and patients in regard to claims, payments, and outstanding balances
* Review explanation of benefits to ensure claims process and pay correctly
* Monitor and identify status of outstanding accounts
* Contact third party payors, patients, or others for outstanding payments
* Process refund transactions for overpaid accounts
* Process correspondence for rejections
* Credential staff with appropriate agencies
* Perform special projects/reports and other duties as requested


**Qualifications:**


* Must have capabilities to work remotely. **Although this position is currently remote, candidate must be able to access the office on occasion**
* Must have experience with UB04/1500 billing
* Must have excellent communication skills and be familiar with working in a fast-paced environment
* Multi state billing experience
* Must possesses excellent organizational skills
* Must be able to analyze processes and conceptualize solutions
* High School diploma or equivalent
* 2+ years of medical billing experience, working with a billing agency or provider’s office
* Strong proficiency with MS Office products and advanced Excel skills
* Experience with EHRs / EMRs / Medical Billing Software is a must
* Proficiency in Carelogic is a plus


**Benefits:**


* Health, dental & vision
* 3 weeks paid vacation
* 11 Paid holidays (including Juneteenth, the day after Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, and NY Eve.)
* Generous sick time including mental health days
* 401k retirement plan with up to 4% match
* Voluntary short and long-term disability
* Voluntary Life Insurance
* Dependent care savings account
* Mileage reimbursement
* Longevity award - Monetary bonus and a vacation day annually
* Company provided laptop and cell phone
* Opportunity for professional growth
* Supervision for licensure provided
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Personal cell phone discount

**Compensation:**


* Full Time - Salary $50,000 - $60,000 depending upon experience

title: Wound Care Nurse Practitioner
description:
We are seeking a Nurse Practitioner specializing in Wound Care to join our team! You will be responsible for the assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of assigned patients in skilled nursing and assisted living settings. This full-time position requires the NP to travel to Essex County and surrounding areas to perform wound care in SNFs and ALFs.

Who We Are:

Kane Wound Care was established in 2009 with the sole purpose of providing high-quality and affordable wound care to all those in need in New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania and surrounding areas. What started with a singular vision to assist nursing home patients has now expanded into a full-fledged wound care conglomerate providing care to over 2000 patients per week. We pride ourselves in the fact that we travel to the patient and not the other way around. Our clinicians are providing service to patients in long term care and assisted living facilities. We firmly believe that our present and future success rests on our company ethos, which is "Honesty, Integrity & Advocacy Towards our Patients."

We are, after all, a collection of doctors, nurses, nurse practitioners, physician assistants, and medical technicians all striving towards the common goal of being the best in the wound care industry. Whether caring for geriatric patients, post-surgical patients, or those with complex health needs, we are committed to providing the most holistic, quality care possible in every case.

Responsibilities:

Manage wound care at skilled nursing and assisted living facilities  
Travel to multiple skilled nursing and ALFs  
Diagnose and establish patient treatment plans  
Assess, monitor and report changes in patient symptoms  
Communicate with collaborating physicians or specialists regarding wound care  
Facilitate referrals to other healthcare professionals and medical facilities  
Maintain accurate patient medical records  
Provide advice and emotional support to patients and their family members

Qualifications:

Previous experience in nursing field  
Familiarity with medical software and equipment  
Ability to build rapport with patients  
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills  
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment  
Knowledge and experience wound and ostomy care

Education and Experience:

Master of Science in Nursing  
Must be boarded in NJ and PA  
BOARD ELIGIBLE IS NOT ACCEPTED  
DEA license  
Excellent customer service skills

Company Offers:

* Competitive salary will commensurate with experience and experience.
* Comprehensive benefits package available: medical, dental and vision insurances;
* 401k with company match;
* Company paid basic life insurance and long-term disability coverage; Company paid basic life insurance and long-term disability coverage,
* PTO, paid sick leave, CME allowance, **all mileage and toll reimbursement**, advancement and career development opportunities.
* Detailed and robust orientation given to all Providers.

Full Time positions available (Monday – Friday)  
NO night or weekend calls, great staff to work with!

Salary: $135,000.00 to $145,000.00/year

title: Poke Bowl - General Staff
description:
**Overview**  
**Job Title:** General Staff

**Location:** Poke Bowl - Jersey City, NJ

**Job Type:** Part-Time / Full-Time

**Pay Rate:** $15 per hour

Expected Opening November or December

**Job Description:**

Poke Bowl NYC is looking for reliable and friendly individuals to join our team at our Jersey City location. As a General Staff member, you will play a key role in providing excellent customer service and ensuring our guests have a positive dining experience. You will be responsible for a variety of tasks, including food preparation, cashiering, and maintaining a clean and welcoming environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Greet customers with a friendly and positive attitude.
* Take and prepare customer orders efficiently and accurately.
* Assist with food preparation, including assembling poke bowls to order.
* Operate the cash register, handle payments, and provide accurate change.
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of the store, including dining and kitchen areas.
* Stock supplies and ingredients as needed throughout your shift.
* Follow all health and safety guidelines to ensure a safe working environment.
* Collaborate with team members to ensure smooth and efficient store operations.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in a customer service or restaurant setting is preferred but not required.
* Must be reliable, punctual, and have a strong work ethic.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment.
* Must be able to stand for extended periods and perform physical tasks, including lifting up to 25 lbs.
* Flexible availability, including the ability to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed.

**Benefits:**

* Typical pay of $15-$17 per hour.
* Flexible scheduling with both part-time and full-time shifts available.
* Opportunity to grow within a supportive and dynamic team environment.
* Employee discounts on delicious poke bowls!

If you are passionate about food, enjoy interacting with people, and want to be part of a growing team, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and availability to be considered for this position.

title: TECHNICIAN, PRODUCTION SUPPORT
description:
At the direction of the Supervisor of Equipment & Testing, support the needs of production and engineering’s long term and short term goals. Coordinate, support and assists facilities maintenance personnel and managers with the setup of and maintenance with production and engineering Acceptance Test Producers (ATP) stations. Work with production test Engineers and supervisors to resolve issues with productions assembly and test stations in a timely manner.

  

REQUISITE SKILLS REQUIRED

* Conceives, designs, builds, and maintains data acquisition systems, proficient computer skills.
* Conceives, designs, builds, and maintains electronic test equipment
* Conceives, designs, builds, and maintains pressurized and ultra-high-pressure test equipment.
* Conceives, designs, builds, and maintains cryo-genic test equipment.
* Maintains the inventory and storage of all related test and fixturing equipment.
* Advanced skill (SME) in troubleshooting Industrial grade plumbing for high purity gases at ultra-high pressure.
* Subject Matter Expert in advanced level troubleshooting techniques and diagnosis of test equipment. Uses analysis to make service and/or repair recommendations.
* Expert in troubleshooting and the diagnosis of problems with high and ultra-high-pressure air compressors, ultra-high pressure N2 and helium compressors. Recommends solutions to management.
* Expert in advanced levels of electronic troubleshooting, diagnosis, and repair.
* Other duties assigned as assigned by management.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

* 1 year experience Direct Current circuitry design and control
* 1 year experience single phase Alternating Current circuitry design and control


EQUIPIMENT/MACHINERY USED

* Basic knowledge in hydraulic, pneumatic and electronic control systems and components.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Lifting up to 50lbs regularly, pushing, pulling, standing for long periods of time, manual dexterity, visual acuity.


**EDUCATION:**

* Highschool or GED is required.
* Associated Degree is preferred.
* Knowledge in electronic troubleshooting, diagnosis and repair required.
* Three (3) years on the job training and Field Certifications is desired.


 We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

title: Medical Receptionist
description:
We are currently seeking a dedicated, detail-oriented medical receptionist to join our Great Neck Headquarters. This is our flagship location, where we've been in practice for over 20 years.

At the core of the role, we are looking for a receptionist who can provide great customer service on a daily basis. Responsibilities include:

* Communicate the importance of physical and occupational therapy to our patients.
* Answer incoming calls promptly and in a customer service friendly manner. The office receives 500-600 calls on a daily basis handled by a team of care coordinators
* Encourage patients to keep their appointments, limiting cancellations.
* Schedule appointments for new and returning patients.
* Complete new patient registration.
* Collect applicable payments.
* Responsible for scanning, importing and handling faxes from doctor offices
* Coordinate with patients, therapists, and as required the insurance team, billing team and home care scheduling team
* Manage the physical therapists and occupational therapists schedules.
* Multiple shifts available
* Compensation: $17.00 - $24.00 per hour in addition to the benefits below:
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Paid holidays
* Health, vision and dental insurance
* Nationwide Pet Insurance Discount

What you will need:

* Must live within 30 minutes driving distance from the Great Neck office
* Excellent customer service skills and a compassion for helping people
* Proficient using an EMR and quick to learn different computer programs
* Experience with managing a multi line phone system
* Self-directed with organizing skills
* Can accurately handle patient scheduling/management
* Punctual and stable work schedule
* Medical reception experience is a plus

**About Us**

Established in 2003, Reddy Care Physical & Occupational Therapy has been featured on the Inc. 5000 list of the fastest growing companies. We were able to achieve this by offering a hybrid business model with outpatient clinics and outpatient home therapy, which was established in 2010. Our outpatient clinics are located in Great Neck, Farmingdale, North Shore Towers, Woodbury, Deer Park, Bayside, Oceanside, Bay Shore, Amityville and NYC. Our strategy is to utilize this model to expand our footprint in the tri-state area, keeping in mind the future growth trajectory of Physical and Occupational Therapy. With this growth comes new opportunities for employees. Our expert team of therapists and administrative staff have been a large reason for our growth. Our goal is to provide our staff members stability, safety, and progressive learning environment. These team members are dedicated to ensuring that our clinical staff have a constant lead staff member that can be available at all times to support all aspects of their clinical experience. Our vision is to continue to establish outpatient facilities, outpatient home therapy and the highest level of clinical decision making for our patients.

title: SQL ETL Programmer/Data Migration Specialist
description:

Conceptualized by the founding partner of a leading personal injury law firm, SmartAdvocate is a leading state of the art legal case management platform that offers flexible deployment options and a modular suite of applications, including both a traditional server and Cloud versions. Legal professionals use SmartAdvocate to manage their law firms which include contacts, communication, new case intake wizards, barcoding of documents, document generation, easy template creation, email and attachment filing, workflow, client portal, Dashboards, iPhone, iPad and Android app, calendaring and docketing. Smart Advocate can also track time, and functionality is available for firms that also want integrated accounting, billing, and invoicing.

**Position Summary**

We are looking for a SQL Developer to work on data conversion projects. Data from legacy case management systems is mapped to fields in SmartAdvocate database. SQL Developer is responsible for creating and running data conversion scripts that move data from old systems to SmartAdvocate.

**Required Skills**

* MS SQL

title: High School Spanish Teacher
description:
Cardinal Spellman High School is the premier co-educational, college preparatory, Catholic High School in the New York Metropolitan Area. Our mission is to promote a culture of aspiration that encourages superior academic performance, leadership and service. We emphasize personal development and we foster a commitment to others that empowers our diverse student population to become leaders who make a difference in our community, nation and world.

We are seeking to immediately employ a full-time Spanish Teacher for the 2024-2025 school year.

The ideal candidate is a motivating and engaging teacher who is committed to serving a diversity of learners in an academically rigorous environment. While demonstrating a passion for teaching Spanish, the candidate will help students develop reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills and apply these skills to their assignments and everyday activities. The candidate will also help students think critically and independently and develop confidence in their own abilities as they build their skills as readers, writers and learners of Spanish. A commitment to inspiring students to appreciate the world of Spanish literature and language and to be lifelong learners is key.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

● Plan, prepare and deliver lesson plans and instructional materials that facilitate active learning

● Develop and use a variety of assessments (e.g., exams, written work, and public performances) that frequently measure student progress

● Maintain an organized classroom environment that facilitates learning  
● Ensure that students master grade-level standards  
● Communicate and maintain high academic expectations for all students

Other Professional Responsibilities:

● Actively participate in department and school-wide meetings, collaborative planning, and professional development

● Participate in teacher-parent conferences regarding students’ progress or concerns  
● Perform supervisory duties such as homeroom, hall, and cafeteria  
● Assist with class coverages

● Actively participate in opportunities to strengthen pedagogical skills  
● Communicate and collaborate effectively with colleagues, families, and students  
● Use data and assessments to inform and drive instruction  
● Pursue their own self-discovery and growth

Qualifications:

● Bachelor’s degree with at least 2 years teaching experience preferred  
● New York State certification preferred  
● Excellent oral and written communication skills  
● Demonstrated commitment to equity and inclusion  
● Energy, enthusiasm, and curiosity – willingness to be a fellow learner with students

We invite interested candidates to apply by submitting a cover letter and resume.

Cardinal Spellman High School is an equal employment opportunity employer committed to hiring exceptional, dedicated teachers of diverse backgrounds.

company: University Settlement Society of New York
description:
University Settlement partners with 40,000 New Yorkers on the Lower East Side and in Brooklyn every year to build on their strengths as they achieve healthy, stable, and remarkable lives. For 135 years, weve collaborated with our communities to pioneer highly effective programs that fight poverty and systemic inequality. Established in 1886 as the first Settlement House in the United States, we bring the values of that movement into the 21st century by meeting New Yorkers where they live, listening to their perspectives, recognizing their excellence, understanding them as complete individuals, and creating space for them to organize. Joining together with our neighbors to advocate for justice and equality, we help build community strength.

**Responsibilities:**

**Case Management**

* Intake/enrollment of children
* Assess the strengths and needs of families, facilitate referrals and follow-up of referrals.
* Assist families with family goal setting and follow-up.
* Accompany parents to meetings as interpreters as needed.
* Work with families of children with special needs; attend case conferences & follow-up meetings.
* Maintain complete, confidential, and up-to-date documentation of family files.
* Maintain/update childrens health files along with the Nurse Consultant.
* Inform families about community resources and how to access services.

**Social Service Database System/Salesforce**

* Maintain and monitor database, ensuring all information is kept current.
* Determine eligibility and follow-up on re-certification for Child Care.
* Maintain and update the waiting list.

**General Program Assistance**

* Assist with parent involvement activities including meetings, workshops,and special events
* Assist with the implementation of the program evaluation process.
* Assist with outreach and recruitment of children.
* Attend meetings, trainings, or workshops off or on-site.
* Assist in the classrooms and conduct home visits.
* Perform general office duties.
* Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor.

**Mental Health Services Support**

* Assist andconduct playgroups
* Attend Mental Health Team Meetings
* Make decisions regarding day-to-day operations in conjunction with the Director

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelors Degree in Social Sciences
* Experience working with children and families
* Bilingual English/Spanish preferred
* Must have excellent computer skills with knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access, and Word

**Work Schedule:** Full time, Monday - Friday,8:00 am - 4:00 pm & 10:00 am - 6:00 pm, 35 hours per week.


We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive community. We support a broadly diverse team who will contribute to our organization. We are an equal employment opportunity for all regardless of race, color, citizenship, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran or reservist status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.
